UAMKpioX1-x_blE5TYfv8A.text: I went back to this place this evening and it was not even close to being as good as it was the last time. When we arrived (7ish) they were out of steak and guacamole! We went ahead and ordered other things but it was not very good. Last of all, we had to wait over An hour for the food to arrive! I won't go back. Ever. I think Guy F should take his sign off his wall!

E6pl8qUWlQJkENtHLbUDmw.text: Sometimes you buy a groupon and then you accidentally don't use it your first try.  So you come back.  That happens.  It happened.  With my two visits to La Santisima, I'd say they know what they're doing.  The offer some dishes that were new to me.  Lonches, for one.  I know what lonche is in Spanglish practice, but what_a_ lonche is, was news to me.  And it was good news.  All around, the food was good.  Salsas are even better.  I did order horchata my first time...but I've totally forgotten what that was like.  That seems to have happened to much of what happened during my first year on the job.  This isn't the only thing I've forgotten.  I've blocked out a lot, apparently.  The service was fine.  I've never seen the place hoping, but maybe the weekend dinner crowd is bashful or something.  Our water cups stayed pretty full and our server was otherwise attentive.  The wait for food was never long.  Cost was fine. It is a gourmet taco shop, after all, so you get what you pay for.  Portions are not huge and style comes with a cost.  The decor is lovely.  I could steal some of their paintings for home, I like them so much.  That is, if they weren't so darn big.  I'd likely give it another visit, that is if we're in Glendale downtown, just walking around, or something.  It seems to be one of the best options.

9Z-HVHDrtOMJ45Sv5kIIVQ.text: This place has classic tacos from Mexico D.F. and a really great salsa bar. The peanut salsa is unexpectedly spicy, and the cilantro salsa is a personal favorite of mine.   I'm a fairly unadventurous eater. Once I find my favorite, I like to stick to it, but that's pretty much impossible here. I want to try everything, and think that over time, I'll eventually get there. Until then, my top recommendations are the street plate with at least 1 mole taco. You'll be upcharged, but if that's your only reason for not trying this piece of delicious, message me for a stronger sales pitch. The point of this place is that if you know what you like, or even if you don't, you'll find something here. Everything tastes like a really good version of what you'd expect at a price point that can't be beat.  Pro tip: toss some cilantro salsa in with your rice :)

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Street tacos plate with rice and beans. Cochinita on the left, pastor in the middle, chicken mole on the right. Yum!

7EjD8w1XGTfxAlve53BoTg.text: Have driven by this place daily for years. Finally stopped to try them and I'm so angry at myself for waiting so long. Very impressive menu but I just stuck with the 3 Taco mix & match plate for my first visit. I will have to say the flavor in these tacos were the best I've ever had. I have been craving them ever since I've tried them. The salsa bar is beyond flavorful. Probably the widest variety I have seen. The artwork and atmosphere is very welcoming. This is definitely a MUST TRY place. Lunch rush can be busy, but that's a good sign!!!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States

1n6M9b2j80S-ORO1BggpGQ.text: We have been coming here for years. Their new menu keeps all of their original greats and added new ones. From Mole to beer battered avocado you can't go wrong here.

a8_Orw_eZ-cCTX4BQauC6Q.text: I like this restaurant because the street tacos were very good and all of the different salsas to pick from were very tasty. I especially like the chipotle salsa, It took me to flavor town. The restaurant was very colorful and nicely decorated. The plates were neat and the staff was very nice and helpful.

09PLO9sLoSNHs-zRGKbqZg.text: First time here we stopped because this place has vegan options. You do have to read the menu carefully because some tacos/burritos have cheese and cream.  I had the coliflor al pastor it was very good. Large portions and the have a great salsa bar as well

aBiO2ty147Y2UdDbqgtHhg.text: Been here several times and it always been good. Decided to bring my mom and wife here for Mother's Day....bad choice! The waiter seemed very inexperience and got our food wrong. Instead of immediately correcting it and offering to get a new plate coming out, he kept trying to make the wrong plate works. He kept bringing out ingredients that are part of the dish as a side or just adding it as a topping. Very disappointed and more than likely won't be coming back for a very long time!!

KBt6djEPuNIIAJDqjnImBQ.text: If I can give negative stars I would. I have never been so disappointed in an establishment in my life. The food was alright. The service was horrible. Not enough parking. Had to ask multiple times for drink food boxes. Some we never got.  Would never set foot in this place again.

sVBM0U32jz33sHwapXSGbg.text: Horrible horrible service. Truly ruined my Sunday night dinner. Waited for someone to seat us and nothing. Then we asked to be seated and then waited 14 minutes! When I lost my patience and went to a server and had to ask for service! Unbelievable! Meanwhile the 2 servers were taking their time doing in urgent things like cleaning table instead of attending customers. So disgusted. I will contacting the owner and possibly the health dept!!!

H3opcdQxSnPTIo7y3RYURw.text: Worst experience, this place has gone way down hill. Called ahead to see if they had guacamole before making the 45 minute drive was told yes they had plenty and weren't close to running out. On arrival was told they were out of guacamole. Food took 50 minutes to get the table and two of the orders were supposed to be 3 chicken street taco plates server came to the table with brisket when we told him that we ordered chicken he came back 5 minutes later with undercooked chicken tacos. Server changed twice and more than 10 servers were standing around while cups and chips were empty.  The bar tender stood in the bar and was eating while behind the bar. One of the servers stood on a bar chair and the bar top to refill the horchata. Super gross super bad service very disappointing no refund was offered.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. 6 street tacos all with under cooked chicken like this. Someone could get really sick from this.

vbAjbyBkgPcGoda1E21pLg.text: The La Santisima Quesa is absolutely delicious!  I crave it all the time.  Order it, you won't be disappointed.    In my opinion, this is the best restaurant within a 10 mile radius of downtown Glendale. It has the best margaritas, tacos, salsa bar and service.  I tipped off my buddy Jason V. to this place and now he's the duke.  It's goooooood.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. La Santisima Quesa, so mouth watering delicious.
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Modelo E.

iJXQeb_5YPO0858erWyh1w.text: I was excited to try this place as had been recommended to me by several people.  The white fish tacos are amazing, the salsa was fresh and yummy! Sadly only one girl was serving the entire restaurant, she did the best she could.  Oddly our table was falling apart, literally the pieces of siding was broke and hanging on, was just hoping it would not pinch our arms. I was ok with the broken furniture; but was very disappointed in the temperature was the adult beverages.  Initially ordered a glass of the house white wine and it was served warm, decided to grab a beer in hopes the beverage temp would be different sadly it was not. The beer was a hair colder then the warm wine, beverage refrigerator may need to be checked. Will try again if see coupon.

ddqkfYf_yK5_h8bEKA2XXQ.text: Go! It took me forever to get around to eating despite being just down the street from me, and boy do I regret that. The food here is amazing! It may seem pricey, but I promise you it is 1000% worth it! The portions are pretty big, I couldn't even finish my plate! (If you like them a little smaller though, go for a bowl.) I can't say enough for the quality or taste of the food. I have since recommended this to everyone I know. So don't hesitate, go!

VL-A8EWj6O46VdLQBzIH4A.text: After coming to this location for a very long time I decided to treat my parents since they had never tried it. Unfortunately their first experience and now our last was a very disappointing one. The food was great as usual but the waitress lacked any customer service skills. We never even got her name because she never introduced herself. But she was the only server at noon on 1/26/17. She Never once acknowledged us when she took our order. It was very uncomfortable as it felt like we were a bother. If you're looking for a great experience this place is not it. Not anymore. It seemed the table next to us was also upset and placed a complaint but she disregarded it and even joked about it the her next table. So I figured it was pointless to complain instead id rather save the bad experience for others.

zJ814MhRkkuTkV6diFs29Q.text: Service sucks. Took over an hour for my 3 tacos and my friends burrito to arrive on a Thursday night with only 4 other tables of small parties who also looked like they had been waiting awhile. But food is good. Just not an hour wait good.

973F7e8jPwNY4lt7jOMNdQ.text: Another Diner, Drive-Ins and Dives spot. GREAT gourmet tacos. SO MUCH FOOD. They have a small bar, but we didn't have drinks. Just lunch on this Sunday. Chicken so good, You can get a 3 taco (mix and match) plate with rice and beans for $13.98.   RICE SO GOOD.   Tried the horacha, not sure it's for me, but it was all gone before we left. Great prices, the waitress was very friendly. GREAT FRESH SALSA BAR. We will be back for sure.

omqZTpj8Rk0uBXggowL0_A.text: This place flipped a 180 on me! I am a regular and I sometimes I used to ask myself why. The food is great but the service is guaranteed to suck. However me N the girl were hungry so we decided to eat some huge burros. On the way we joked about bringing a book while we wait. But this time we were seated right away,  bright drinks and our order came out in record time all thanks to JUAN our server. I felt like I was on that show Bar Rescue and they cleaned how and got service as good as their food. It was a nice change to not have moody, disrespectful waitress girls that they usually have. I hope it stays like this or perhaps Juan can give lessons.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. The Gaucho Burro! Enchilada style!

ghls7y_8JD09kr6TmYxvQg.text: My new favorite medium scale Mexican restaurant in Phoenix.   Very high quality and simple.   The oxacan cheese, fresh herbs and spices, grilled chiles, the 10+ salsa bar options and the homemade horchata with berries and nuts are all you need to know. Vegan and vegetarian options!

k0AxypEZq18yUDC0Gy7-Bg.text: Tacos were awesome and such a large selection of salsa at salsa bar. Severs were very nice. All around great choice!

LdfyMgoGMVEovJluqEdz0g.text: So today I took my family to this place based on what I had seen on Yelp and the photos. So we get there and we are told there would be a 30 min wait but there where a lot of empty tables so we wait. After 20 min we were seated and are drink order is taken! My beer dos xx it was warm and bitter. We were given chips so we went to the salsa bar only to be disappointed with the salsas taste some where even a little spoiled. Are food arrived it looked really good on our plates my wife got the chicken mole tacos  meal. The tacos were really good! The beans were also starting to spoil and the rice was less then average. For my order I got the "santo Plato" pastor burrito and a pastor taco. With calabas on the side the calabas was the only thing good on my plate! My pastor burrito meat was burnt and I know they do it intentionally to give it a little flavor but they over did it. It tasted like I was eating coal. As for the service it was good they came to you with a smile. As of now I will maybe try there other location in the hopes that it will be better.

TTqYlJKzH5hjTT2y0ItRIA.text: Food was fantastic, had the Marlin Kay-so-dillas. Horchata was off the chain! going to be going back soon. Our server was great and friendly.

MfL5sBqLDaUhutjZ5qq6Rw.text: This place has excellent gourmet mexican food... When they actually have ingredients in stock. I drove 25 minutes all the way from Goodyear to come here. And it seems each time I am disappointed they don't have avocados for my guacamole, sometimes they are out of carne Asada, maza, and salsa... WTF?? What kind of mexican restaurant runs out of carne Asada??? It wasn't even noon yet. Although the food is excellent, the experience is often inconsistent since they never seem to have everything they need to make the food the customers want to order. I would love to give a 5 star review and recommend this place to everyone, once they get figure out a way to keep ingredients in store. As for now I will bask in my disappointment.

62UYS1oSJR5m2B8crnXrrg.text: So so awesome!! The salsa bar was huge and armed with more types of salsa than I could possibly taste in one sitting. Anyway the tacos were more than filling and very tastey. As far as the location lets just say I drove past it and had to do a u-turn. I was not expecting it to be "right next to" La perila. Which is another mexican food place but has been around for quite awhile. So here you go.... If you are looking for a mexican dish enchilada style that can be eaten with a soup spoon?? Go to La Perila, which is good don't get me wrong. But if your looking for a flavor party of some really good authentic mexican food go to La Santisma. There is a good chance you too will be excited to share this place with others. Don't want to forget the staff was very friendly and helpful. The layout of this place is cool and family like. Nice front patio that would be pretty cool come sundown. Welp Enjoy I sure did and will again.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Shrimp and Black Mole` tacos

yf9P1vauYQVPDtRTKPLW6Q.text: Place was super cool. Great food. Sat in the patio... Could've used some umbrellas for shade. Would've liked to see some drafts but nonetheless, the bottled beer selection was great. The wait staff seemed a tad unprofessional. But I'm sure with time and good promotion this spot can be a hit. My husband and I will definitely be back for the great fish and shrimp tacos :)

YEuD6SM85ZHsxGQPkQtR3w.text: My husband and I would go here every week since they opened.. But it seems as though since the owner hasn't been in the place lately the restaurant is going down hill... The 2 waitresses have a very poor attitude... Last week we went the girl waitress had an attitude and told my sister in law they were out of rice & michelada's!  Went back today and the waitresses would not even wait on us! Another couple sat next to us and they give them menus & chips!!! We waited 20 minutes before walking out! Mind you have been loyal customers since they opened their doors! The food was great but has gone down hill!

WZ3wZduPhVfExf9nAxvhSw.text: Best food this side of the Colorado. Al pastor Quesadilla and mole tacos were off the chain. And their tamarindo margarita was the best ever. Will drive from San Diego just for it. Salad bar has so many options

uOlV2PkeuFm5HuobBvBHWQ.text: Food is good, but no the best I've tried, the best feature in this restaurant is their salsa bar. I was disappointed they don't carry enchiladas...really, a Mexican place selling as "authentic" doesn't carry enchiladas? Don't get me wrong, it's pretty good, although the prices could be a little bit lower.

VDuGGvqAHWkPnOHpAoiCPw.text: I'm writing this review in hopes that management sees it or even the owner. I've been coming here for a couple of years now and my visits have been ones to remember. I was a loyal customer coming in once a week at least. The previous staff this restaurant had were amazing. You can tell they really enjoyed their job. They made me feel like I was at home. I was always taken care of by one particular server every Thursday night. Stacey, she was an outstanding employee and I enjoyed her attentiveness with us. Stacey was a hard worker and she put dedication to her job role. I decided to continue to go after she resigned but it just wasn't the same anymore. The new servers aren't polite with you. They don't listen to your concerns. They simply take your order bring your food and never check on you again. They don't ask if you need a refill or another basket of chips (most simple things a server can do). They are simply rude. It seems as if they simply want your money and want you out of there quick. Even though their food is delicious, if you don't have good service then it makes your experience horrible all around. For this reason I will not be returning but I hope this gives them a heads up to make changes and improve their service.

jZhMPcV_jNvdl2ID9S5Bsw.text: This place was delicious and different! Has vegan and vegetarian choices.  Loved the many different salsas from the salsa bar. Laid back atmosphere.  Friendly staff. Will definitely return!

Yz5tGUJWYQRhR6aG2Iv1vQ.text: This restaurant, and the one on 16th street, are both outstanding.  The best, most interesting Mexican food in the Phoenix area.  And, reasonably priced.  The portions are so large that we  always end up taking half of it home for another meal.  The dishes are very unique and stunning.  The salsa bar is incredible.  I hardly go anywhere else anymore when I go out to eat, because other restaurants seem so boring and lack imagination, compared to these restaurants.  I just wished they sold their dozens of salsas in carry out jars/bottles.  I would buy all of them!

2eIKQsE1RBduvT7qq72oqw.text: Great food and service. Carne Adovada was awesome. Has a kick and great flavor. Thier salsa bar has a varity of flavors. We'll be back. Also has a full bar.

0OOHsLLrG9pvdk4dy1kExw.text: The food is always great,  I have been here maybe 5 times and only one of those times were we waited on in a timely manner.  They drop the menu off and then go away for at least 10-15 minutes.  For some reason the wait staff refuses to write down any orders.  I'd rather they write them down instead of getting them wrong. The lack of staff is the downfall of this place.  Can't deny the meat and the food is fantastic.

WYONVKOdWIWE4-UZBKo6eg.text: Very under impressed.. Food was average and that is being generous.. Not to mention there was a hair in my food and they took it back, came back out and claimed it was "cheese" and still was charged for it.  The bathrooms are also disgusting.  Save yourself the time and go down the street to Carambas.

92O6k6PQNm6U3eecC8MKAw.text: 4 star food with 0 star service so I compromised. We walked in and questioned if anyone even worked there. We waited about 5 minutes before I had to walk over to the bartender and ask if it was self seating. I was told that they have to clear the tables which were full and that's why we weren't sitting yet. Thanks... I guess? So we finally sit and its 15 minutes before were asked what we want to drink and are given menus. About 10 minutes later the bar tender walks up and says "I'm not your waiter but I'll help you" the girl that was supposed to be our waiter was in her own world staring at the POS system like she was having problems creating people checks, but I think she just didn't want to face all the mad diners looking impatient around me. People that walked in 15-20 minutes after me are already getting Togo boxes and pretty much the same issue was present with the table next to us. We came in five minutes after him yet finished eating before he received his food. There was no order or massive issues in the kitchen or both. Even a walk up Togo order was in and out quickly, but the man was complaining about receiving the wrong food. The waitress seemed to argue back with customers or give excuses. It was very unacceptable customer service wise. I will never go back or recommend this place even though the food was good. Near the end of the meal we were told the food was great (which it was) but the service was horrible (also True) by a staff member. Why can't you fix it if you know it's wrong? If you order take out I would suggest the street tacos as they are all very good. If the restaurant isn't busy I'm sure the service doesn't struggle (as I've experienced the first time I went in) but when I returned on a date to careless and horrible service I know it's not worth my time to return.

WuiGerrflqFoYkj9D0uLJA.text: I love this place. I have been eating at the original one on 16st and palm ln for about 2 years. This one is even better!  I love the quesadillas. Not your moms quesadilla!  I almost always get th he chicken mole in the quesadilla.  Love it. I have tried almost everything.  I would also recommend chicken Tinga. Shrimp tacos are awesome. Try all 20 of the salsas. Including,  pecan, hicima.  Green toatilllo is awesome. The Margaritas are fresh with chunks of fruit! Yummy! Enjoy.

ei5OYn_hjZAIHBaj7JkWjg.text: I recently went to La Santisma when I saw that their Pacific White Fish taco was on the list of "Top 100 Dishes to try in Phoenix". This taco was one of the worat tacos I have ever tried. The fish was covered in a thick beer batter and was so dark and smelled awful. I should have known better when the server said she'd never tried it because "she's very picky about her fish". We also tried their Gaucho quesdadilla based on a suggestion from the server. The quesadilla tasted like a deep fried blob of cheese with some pieces of steak.  The strawberry salsa from the salsa bar was the only thing that made the quesadilla palatable. The salsa bar should be labeled by spiciness. There are tons of options, but most of the salsa is so spicy, that you couldn't taste anything else (I imagine that whoever said the fish taco was a "top 100 dish" smothered the fish in a salsa that made tasting the actual fish impossible).  The horchata was very good with fresh fruit and nuts, hence the 2 star rating.

YR-Kf9MK0sV_4H_NMrtifg.text: First of all, we love coming to this place, but last night service was really badddd as they only had 2 people waiting on approx 10/11 tables. It was a disaster for a Saturday night. . We tried to be patient and understand that they are short staffed and actually felt sorry for the servers, we even had to go get chips and water on our own because we were not waited at all.  Customers kept coming and we noticed that 2 different tables got their food before us even though we were there wayyyy before them, so  we asked the server what's going on with our food and stated that the kitchen was just grabbing tickets randomly.  One lady was  clearing tables while food was waiting to be served.  We were obviously disappointed!  Not sure what kind of management they have or I wonder if they even have one.  The servers are new ( that's  what we were told) and I am not blaming them for last night's disappointment,  the OWNER hopefully is reading this.  Will not go back ; as note to owner- Hire some help and train your staff .  We left after almost an hour of waiting.  No, we did not get our food after all that wait.

80EJlhEGWe9jrUCPseyw4w.text: Okay, work meeting got bumped an hour so went to look for lunch with my wife in Glendale. Came across this restaurant  and wow, this is by far the absolute best Mexican food we have found in AZ. Really a great atmosphere and our server is all over it. Bottom line, this is the small little hole in the wall to find. The absolute best I've found. Will definitely be here again, and again.

36_qrdtmIRbWVkIMRcTG_A.text: Awesome to see more gems like this on this area. Carne Asada is fantastic. Great selection of salsas and house margarita is the perfect stand by to cool things down. Only complaints are the wobbly tables, missing drink menu and absent children's selection

wyHgaHiWZ3zLsgg9iui2_g.text: Omg amazing! I had the La Santisima burrito and it was so good!! The horchata was the best I've ever had and the La Santisima margarita was so good! I will definitely go again!!

ugMKYHBqUbtt8mTsgGn3gg.text: Can't say enough about this place.  I don't really go back to places time after time.  But over the last few years I've been back 6 times.  First off... deep fried crispy quesadillas.  Total food porn/mouth-gasm every time.  Exotic menu, tiger shark shrimp, wicked carne asada, and even baby SHARK TACOS!!! call it my go to for peeps looking for an extended friend lunch.

_mz7WUisEa6CJqacWH2gzQ.text: My daughter and I went there for dinner. When we walked in we were not greeted. I went to the bar and asked if we seat ourselves, the lady behind the bar said that we could choose a table and they would come clean it. Long story short, no one one ever came over. As we sat that 2 parties were sat down, given menus, and chips. We walked out! We hope our race had nothing to do it hit?

eZHuRlkUA_3REHHfgeODLw.text: Over priced for the food.  I got burro stuff with rice and beans very little meat.  Nothing nice about bitting into a fatty piece of meat. For the price you would think have decent amount of meat.  My husband mexi burro which cost 21.98 enchilada style! Only 4 piece of meat in the burro.  I enjoy horchata I have to say.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States

4OQr0O9nBWtUmqbGjw_lmQ.text: I met three fellow vegan friends for lunch today at La Santisima. It was my first time there.  It was positively delightful.  Our server (who may have been an owner) was so welcoming and gracious.  The place was pretty busy for a Monday lunch, which is always a good sign.  Our food was fresh, creative, authentic, and oh so delicious.  They have plenty of vegan and vegetarian options that are clearly indicated on the menu.  We all had burros.  I wanted to try every burro on the menu since they all sounded amazing.  The fresh salsa bar, with it's selection of mild to hot salsas, was a added bonus.  I'm anxious to go back and bring my husband and daughter.  Thank you La Santisima for making us vegans feel so welcome.  We will be back!!!  And next time, I will bring a larger group.

CWrplFw3ITevKPX6piRinQ.text: The only good thing about this place was the salsa bar. Lots of variety which was nice... we ordered the fundido queso dip which was literally a big lump of white cheese. You couldn't even dip a chip in it! It was awful. The margaritas were weak and tasteless as well . The staff was friendly but the food and drink were anything but desirable.

nOsFKwJzxz7JkDbX_zbeQg.text: All I have to say is amazing!! They have vegan and vegetarian options. This place is one of my favorite authentic Mexican food spots. They have a fried avocado taco that I keep going back for. They have a really good horchata. I would recommend this place to anyone.

Hya-CMzCSQUh3IMd0MuKiA.text: Delicious, authentic Mexican food with the most amazing salsa bar! We were a very large party and they weren't prepared for us, but they did their very best to accommodate our group! Food was very good and they served a great margarita. Very reasonable

D6QRoAjgeAQJFRDM4_z57A.text: Good food, only one waitress, working hard, but is great to eat a Mexican food . I guess they need more people for cleaning and service the clients.

dJaRRTu3cCe5R2QQ4mwF-g.text: I was very enthusiastic to finally eat at this place because of all the good reviews, but was disappointed. First of all the place was filthy, tables were dirty, food on the floor, I felt bad because there was only one server but based on appearances i would not recommend this place.  The food was ok nothing special I was expecting better. I ordered a quesadilla, it looked delicious don't get me wrong but it had no flavor. Mom ordered chicken tacos and was quiet upset that they served her food on a broken plate. If your looking for authentic Mexican food then this place is not for you.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Broken plate
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States

HRgDcPJk4p1-kdDgvkMDhg.text: I was excited to eat here as I'd heard good things but was mostly disappointed.  Their horchata was really good but that was about it. They didn't allow us to order a side of just beans and rice for our kids which I found strange and I ordered 2 horchatas, 1 for me and 1 for my kids to share. They brought the kid's out in 2 separate tiny cups; not even close to half of a full serving and still charged us for a full size! I ordered tacos with beef brisket and the meat was dry and chewy.  In the end I was dissatisfied with their food and service.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Horchata with fruit and pecans

P7EDhR2J1JTb8DCCYb0Uag.text: Taco's are something I could eat on a daily basis so when my husband and I discovered La Santisima's, I was very excited. Their gourmet taco's are unlike anything I've tasted before. The menu carries a variety of different taco's and beverages. The salsa bar was satisfying. The service does need to step it up a bit at this particular location which is why I gave it a 4. Otherwise, great little hidden gem.

l2j51sgQoNBo7waqnFwKWg.text: Omg. Amazing!  The food here is so rich and filling, i couldnt get it into my mouth fast enough.. i seriously was in heaven..   The salsa bar is to die for. All their salsas are amazing. Im a sucker for salsa that has a good garlic taste with a kick. These were perfect for my taste buds. I enjoyed EVERY single one! They are not overly spicey either where you can enjoy your food. Also you get free chips and you bet i got every single salsa to go with my chips and meal!  I ordered the asada street tacos. It came with rice and beans. They were AMAZING. Beans were rich and creamy, rice was salted perfectly. The meat was not fatty at all, which is huge for me because most resturants have such fatty asada.   The place was decent and extremely clean. Artwork was amazing too. There seemed to only be one waitress in the whole resturant which was fine she was nice and attentive. The place is decently priced and well worth the food if you enjoy mexican. Honestly i wasnt even done with my meal and i was already plotting when to come back and tell everyone how good it was.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States

_5tkmgCeCGCP9FUbTdcNWg.text: This bartender from Souhern Rail recommended La Santisima.  I read some of the reviews and went in a bit knowledgeable.  First let me say, the service is very very very slow.  But the reviews mentioned that.  About 10 minutes of sitting before anyone came to the table.  There were only two other tables.  Ordered drinks and they arrived ten minutes later.  Ordered our food when the waiter came back another 10-15 minutes later, and more chips.  Our food arrived another 15-20 minutes later.  They brought our trio taco plate and a couple of other tacos.  The food was delicious!   We enjoyed our meals and about 20 minutes later when the waiter came back we placed an order for take out for someone at home.  Another 15-20 minutes it came with the bill.  The waiter brought out a tablet. Which he used for ordering, and just had the screen to the "fixed " tip amount.  I had to ask him to show me the bill.  All good I guess.  Soooooooo, don't go in like you're starving. Know it will be like one of those looooong five course meals and enjoy.  I will go back again knowing how the service is and more likely be more precise in tipping since the service isn't reflected in the "fixed tip" amount.  Next time I'll customize it.

KQ4YnxFgJUiT8GHWyeknJw.text: Wow!! The place does not lie! The name says it all - gourmet tacos!!   Upon arrival, I noticed the authentic touch with the outside doors - 3 to be exact. Check out the pics! Then coming inside, I see vibrant colors with matching works of art affixed on the walls. A patio is also available if you're looking to soak in some sunshine.   Once seated, we got a basket of warm chips. They have an amazing salsa bar with a variety of flavors to try. Some of the ones we tried were the: pecan, cilantro, La Santisima salsa, chipotle, radish of some sort, guacamole, and more. So fun to try different spicy kick flavors!  Today I tried the Aztec Tinga taco (a Mexico City specialty), which is shredded chicken with tomato, onion, and Aztec chipotle salsa. It's got a little spice, but balances out with the double corn tortilla. This taco was meaty and juicy!   The other one I tried was the Mayan Cochinita Pibil taco - a Yucatan speciality! This was a True fork tender pork shoulder with achiote rojo topped with lime marinated onions and salsa Habanera Maya.  Lots of meat!! Love!   I also had the chance to try the La Santisima special taco with chicken and cheese and a steak filled taco. Both were amazing as well. Each of these were ordered a la carte ($4-$5 each). If you order 2 of the same, you get it with a side of rice and beans. The beans have a bit of spice and the rice included kernels of corn. Yummy!   Finally, I ordered their version of a horchata. It is unlike any other horchata I've tried! It's my first one that included fruits and pecans! Quite unique and refreshing!   I'm looking forward to trying the other gourmet tacos and hopefully will make room for the flan!!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. La Santisima chicken special &amp; steak
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Aztec Tinga taco and Mayan Cochinita Pibil taco
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Huge horchata!

nVRvo159dJdTz3g1NkHNjw.text: Beat tacos and service I have had in a long time! The gourmet tacos were fresh and delicious. The white fish taco was my favorite. Fresh and delicious... I cannot wait to go back!

bfJmHRnhQBMsjeMD1K_K6Q.text: I was hungry for tacos so I went onto Yelp and found this hidden gem! I've lived here my entire life and never heard of this place! Wow... best tacos in the west valley! Definitely go here if you are craving an authentic flavorful taco - you will not be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States

YsDn1sGZkteMs9pnUZTIsg.text: This place delivers excellent gourmet tacos, delicious horchata, and Mexican bottled sodas. I can't wait to go back. It was so delicious and they had over 10+ tacos to choose from as well as other Mexican entrees. They don't have a kids menu, but the waitress helped find some tacos my kids would like. Definitely recommend and will return!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. The salsas were so good.
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. So many delicious hot sauces and salsas to choose from! Tacos were also phenomenal.

-Gv1wi_ObVZnrywGtrXcFQ.text: Simply amazing!! From start to finish this is one of my many favorite places for tacos, and margaritas. The food has a lot of flavor, the drinks are freaking delish. One of the best places for a good margarita. I been to both 16st and 60th Ave location, and will say I love how the 60th Ave location has more parking then the 16st location. With that said, I don't mind driving for a good mexican meal. Great work guys!!! Keep it up!

jcpO9_xEXuXrIJYpyDI30A.text: To sum up- the place was great.  Food was tasty and served promptly. Our waitress made great suggestions, which can be necessary as the menu is huge and it can be overwhelming.  We went with tacos- one street and one gourmet. They didn't disappoint.  I do have to say that there are other places with more "street like food" that I prefer. However, this was still pretty good.

6lrn8axg8ScumY0mkxiRkg.text: Been here 3 times the quality of the food is so good. The best tacos I have had since moving from LA. The quesadilla I got was so good I ate the whole thing! The asada street taco and mole taco is just the best. The horchata was very good and unique. The salsa bar is good and clean too.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Wonderful paintings
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Unique horchata

tsai8uRCY5m-62QbONtytQ.text: My tinga taco was soggy as if they left it there for awhile. The salsa bar was amazing and the customer service was too. The reason why I gave it 3 star is because we were charged gratuity even though it was only 5 of us. The receipt clearly said 6 people or more. My party was going to give her more than the gratuity rate, but because of that, we decided not to give her anything. I shouldn't be asked to give them tips. I want to tip them according to the service.

TeTpYdQU8Zjj7g_hza2cVg.text: The salsa bar here is the best! I really liked the food. The tacos are small but filling. Many dishes come with a side of beans and rice and they are delicious! Had a quesadilla before...not quite like Mexico city but it had good flavor just thicker but a huge portion. Service has always been fast and friendly so no complaints there.

EFIgAUtOZU8E0PhVf9rF0w.text: I absolutely love this place! it has become one my fav spots since I moved to AZ from Cali. The horchata is amazing!!! and so is everything else. I highly recommend the cabo shrimp tacos. And you can't beat their signature margaritas. And last but not least their salsa bar. OMG delicious!! My go to is the pecan salsa. So many to choose from.

w8YXSO1B6WLh89tjNtAFdQ.text: This is one of the best taco/burrito places in Phoenix. Tiny place so it gets packed quickly but well worth the wait. Love the salsa bar and Margs too.

7xvaFmEi1OLSdPegZn02YA.text: Service was super slow we waited 70 minutes from when we ordered to get our food. Food was cold the only good thing was the chips and salas waitress blamed it on having only one cook because the other two cooks left early. Will never go back there hopefully the one off 16th street is better. Oh and my Wife had to leave the bathroom door cracked open with a chair because the light was burnt out

Ya2i4SFvIlMmQcqDEqirGg.text: This place is amazing!! Can't say enough good things about this restuarant! The set up is nice and the art work is superb! A great place to go have a date night or a quiet family dinner. The food is always fresh, (highly recommended the el pastor quesadilla!!)   The only thing negative per se about this place is the service. They really need another waiter. I give respect to the guy that works there solo, but he's so busy hustling and bustling that it's hard for him to give adequately good service when he's rushing through our orders. We have been there 3 times and each time it is the same, 4 or 5 tables and we end up waiting 20 minutes to get a drink order.  I love the atmosphere and food too much to stop going, just hope they hire another waiter in the near future!!  Definitely recommend this place to others!!!

C1RiivsQmFpihfFh9FodXA.text: Great gourmet tacos, great salsa bar, and huge portions!  Was hoping for better street tacos though.

Dp3Dg_p6LknggFszZkqtAQ.text: Our friends recommended the 16th St location a month or two ago and it was so simple yet awesome.  The salsa bar is fun and so many tasty varieties to try.  I really like the jicama, cilantro, peanut and of course traditional ones.  The menu is a little confusing but once you kind of figure it out, you're good.  I was suggested to try the grapefruit margarita by my friend and it as so refreshing.  Usually most places margarita's are loaded with that awful sour mix but this did not give me any weird after taste or belly aches :)  So of course had to get it again at this location and just the same, good!  Then last time I had tried two different tacos.  One was pork the other beef and the beef was incredible.  I then tried the beef yesterday in their quesa version and oh my.  Such a neat presentation and so good.  Loved the fresh sliced avocado on the top.  Even took half home for leftovers.  Can't wait to go back and try other items too.  I have heard about the horchata's but have not had enough room at the end of my meal to try them but maybe next time.

Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. grapefruit margarita (don&#39;t remember official name on the menu)

2fN4sWwB-xLEWPsicYN-BA.text: This was an interesting place. I was craving tacos and what's better than going to the taco shop. I tried one of their steak tacos and they were alright. Awesome salsa bar, never had strawberry salsa nor sweet pecan. It's a little pricey but hey guess that's the gourmet part. Will definitely try more items on the menu. Staff was very nice. I wanted a strawberry lemonade and since they only had regular lemonade the guy made me some and honestly wasn't bad at all.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. What I ordered.
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Trying salsa

dG1E2PqQVejmhyvTAKlUVA.text: This was my first time here. I was glad to see new blood come into the downtown Glendale area. I spend a lot of time in this area and I'm always looking for a new spot.   The decor and styling of the restaurant is great. I loved the paintings and lighting throughout. There is ample seating although we came on a very busy night.   Now for the bad news. We waited nearly an hour for a total of 8 tacos between 4 people. We were told by the manager that he was sorry and he was missing two servers and a cook. Sadly I did see people leave prior to getting food due to service. I can only hope this gets addressed.   On the good side the tacos were excellent. I ordered two steak tacos, while my friend ordered one steak and one shredded pork. He also described the steak taco as good but he said the pork was delicious.   Great menu with lots of choices. I will go back and hope the service issue is fixed.

DAnBvPM9eBZQMYl2pWsHbA.text: I've had my share of Margaritas and I must admit that these are the best in town. However, the new Glendale location needs to catch up on the quality of Margaritas as the ones they serve at their parent location (16th street and McDowell). I have faith that they will as they begin to settle down at their new location.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Great place for margaritas.

tp6AjZj-Kh4SJPi9DkeFzw.text: Great food.  Pleasantly surprised with how good and varied the salsa bar is.  Wish I could afford to eat there more often, but you get what you pay for!

59Ffs_v3YH9wYSdtRZl6rA.text: Food was really good. I had a Quesa and it was not the ordinary quesadilla. The horchata was also unique. I am definitely going back to try the shark tacos.   I would have given it 5 stars but it was warm in there. In AZ you do not want to go from baking outside to eating in a warm restaurant. There was also only one server working.

VDPCareHICxUdISSWv5rbw.text: My wife and I waited over 2 minutes when we walked in and no one even acknowledged us even though a waiter walked by us. We had to grab her on her way back to ask to be seated as she didn't seem to want to even acknowledge our presence. The place was maybe 60% full, so it wasn't busy by any means. After a while, she came back and said it'd be at least 5 min before they could seat us as they had to bus a table. While waiting, another couple came in behind us, was helped immediately and was told the same table would be available soon for them. The waiters were chatting away and a couple of them were even flipping through their phones. For being behind, there was no sense of urgency from any of the staff to catch up. We left as there were way too many warning signs that it'd be very poor service for our meal. I shouldn't have ignored the other reviews that said the service was going downhill--don't make the same mistake.

emoLI3jXQ2DcsMcO8UI_lQ.text: The tacos here were amazing! I had a shrimp taco and the black mole taco. It was great!! The salsa bar has a huge selection of fresh made salsas. My only complaint would be that they were out of guacamole when I came in which broke my heart. But next time I'm definitely going to try it. The margaritas are definitely spot on too, definitely a must try if you are in the area!

irC4H4jY9MjwC2nNNMIb7Q.text: The food isn't as good as the location on 16th street. The Glendale location is either understaffed and can't accommodate busier days or the staff isn't that great. Either way my biggest complaint is customer service. We waited a good 15-20min and no one ever came to give us menus let alone take any drink order. We ended up leaving and I'm pretty sure no one even noticed. It's disappointing as I was really excited to see a location open closer to my house. The service is great at the 16st location but normally has a wait for seating as it is a smaller location. Needless to say, I won't be returning to the Glendale location.  I'd rather wait for a table and have better service and food.

PZNhB7f69g-m69GdUmo4kQ.text: Everytime I go, I am reminded just how good the food is. Not to mention the quality is fantastic. If you haven't been, you are missing out.

Jx0jVeYoBl9VabH1a2HY1A.text: Stopped by for lunch with coworkers, boss's treat, wasn't sure what to expect but I was pleasantly surprised. I ordered the Arabe Burro which is basically a Gyro/Burrito fusion drenched in hummus. I loved it so much I had to remake it at home. Will be back with the family for sure!

o-cuCkUEB8bHuIOmybqhlQ.text: This place is DELICIOUS. The food outstanding and the salsa is on point. But there is only one server every time I come. It takes 20 mintues for my order to be taken and another 30 mintues until my food arrives. By then my drink is usually long gone. Please get more servers!

VyouFsvxN9SpuBQNKK2HfA.text: Wow. Not a huge fan of beans but theirs are so good would make a meal of beans alone. This place is a must go.

8u7gu9kT4rQMi9Va5GRung.text: Ate here for dinner tonight and this place is amazing. Grass fed beef carne asada, amazing drinks (Margaritas) and delicious tacos. I would recommend this place for sure!

hEr8gGqDSaMj7HldRi5QUg.text: Really good street tacos. Good service and affordable beer. Amazing pecan salsa - yes pecan, I'm not joking, go try it.

sV-jDjGO3c_o2icnnQ0iIg.text: The salsa bar was fun and interesting. Maybe not quite as tasty as I had hoped. But it was amusing to try so many different styles of salsa.  When people say get the horchatta, they mean it. Get that thing. Lots of flavor. Not too sweet. Overall very much worth the price.  The tacos were wonderful and this was the first time I had mole that I really liked it. So much deep flavor. Give this place a chance. It is not like the stereotypical heavy, greesy food that we've come to expect. But the flavors are amazing.

HsDQWFVyxONmA7oEGWo1sQ.text: Second time here. The first time, they had no cold beer for the michelada I ordered, the girl had to come back 3 times before she could get it right with a cold beer. The second time they got our order wrong. Asked for eggs over easy with chorizo, she came with scrambled eggs and chorizo. We sent it back and she brought the same exact thing. They had it on the menu with over easy eggs. However the servers don't understand what over easy means. The food is "ok", but when I ordered a street taco it was way over priced for the size and quality. Not recommending or going back here again.

J1HleambjemMNCo9tMZNlA.text: Had the 3 Street taco plate, Al Pastor, Carne Asada & Cochinita Pibil. Delicious! Wife had the La Santisima veggie taco plate. Very hardy for veggie only. The salsa bar selection was awesome, all very tasty. The wait staff was attentive, knowledgeable on the dishes. Used a Groupon for this introductory visit. Will so be coming back.

MQC8aBrmTJM8ZKnn6yy5dQ.text: So many salsas at the salsa bar, which is like candy land for someone like me! I had the Carne Asada  taco and Aztec Tinga burrito and my lady had the street tacos ,the food was different , don't know if I'll  ever come back to this places . G28mCdZ93JpgBRKLFO9Y2A.text: Stopped in for lunch, the incredibly LARGE parking spaces in a small amount of space leads me to believe this place was either small inside or has horrible drivers for customers, once i entered i assume now it is the latter, a spacious dining room, bar, and outdoor seating available.  First off i ordered a horchata, which was the second best i have ever had, they put a good variety of fruits in there that perfectly complemented the flavor..   I then ordered some street tacos, and before they came out i walked up to the Salsa Bar.. oh man, i need more than just a spoon for this place, they have every flavor you would expect, and an delicious peanut salsa.. it was soo tasty i don't even know if the tacos themselves were any good, guess i gotta go back!

gx3sGWsri6s0W1jr-MWV1Q.text: I've been here twice and I was not disappointed either time. First of all their salsa bar as one of the best I have ever experienced as far as choices and taste. There are tacos and quesadillas are top notch. This place is one of my top five restaurants for Mexican food. I also like that when I get my plate the food is piping hot and you can tell the ingredients are fresh. I find their prices to be very reasonable and their staff was kind and attentive. If you've never been here you have to check this place out. I'm certain he will not be disappointed. :)

v2gqW4ZoMZ8Lr40uUXNUnw.text: Might just be the best Mexican food in Arizona. Not exaggerating by even the slightest. Their flavors are so bold and incredible. Whatever Mexican dish you like they make the best version of it I can guarantee it. I love this place.

l5b0ijqPfAMd6C1u-hI1MQ.text: Food was excellent. Great service. The restaurant was nice and good music. We definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Al pastor Quesa, was amazing :)

2W4_7003xPkUwXkGvxqV7w.text: Petty expensive for ordinary street tacos. Our server was friendly, but service was slow and disorganized.  Half of the many salsas at the bar were empty. Not a well run operation. Food had good flavor, but for the price I am sure there are better options. Will not be back.

YxYL0zh2c63lLcTYmtIf7Q.text: Been wanting to try this place for a while and finally did. Had the carne asada street taco plate with jamacia. It was delish -- took me back to Rocky Pointe vacations. The beans are authentic and the rice is white Salvadorian style. Great art work and service. Can't wait to go back.

JRt6692oZfaxPsyqAkDm4Q.text: We went hiking the day after Thanksgiving and after that we were starving. I have been wanting to try this place out for a while, we loved it!! Not only did we enjoy the atmosphere & music, the food was seriously good!! I have to watch my carb intake and my husband discovered they had tacos protien style SCORE!! they were beautiful, looked like enchiladas.  I had the chicken tinga and gaucho steak tacos, the taste was an explosion sooo good!! Even the kids loved them. We really liked this place, the pictures of skeletons were awesome, our teen girls really thought it was cool! We will be back for sure!

Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Womens bathroom door, loved it!
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Men&#39;s bathroom door, so cool!!

p2XxsNfUyCBTyfF0hUkGlA.text: Where do I start? We are on our trip out here from Los Angeles, California and on our way back home we stopped here. First , the salsa bar is amazing!!! Sooo many choices and different ideas than what I'm used to. I ordered a few tacos al a carte and the meats are sooo good and the sauces they use are super tasty. I will be definitely be telling my friends about this place when I get back.

VhCbCxEVspGoHbkddRyYHw.text: This place is completely unique and the food is very good. They have this thing they call a quesa, which is raw corn tortilla dough that they roll out and stuff with the meat of your choice (we tried the Sonora Arrachera Quesa), close it up and deep fry it. OMG, what a flavor explosion! We also had the Carne Asada and Aztec Tinga tacos. Both were delicious, but fair warning, the Tinga is a tad messy to eat, so don't wear white. Their list of taco and burrito options is lengthy, (including meatless) and there has to be something for everyone. I was a little dissapointed in their salsa bar. It has tons of tasty choices, but really, most of them are what I think of as sauces (no texture) and not salsas. Great for the tacos, not so much for the chips. Besides the chips, there is nothing with any crunch (i.e. flauta, crispy taco, chimichanga) on the menu, which is odd since they do fry the Quesas (they have a light crispiness, but the thickness of the dough prevents them from being crunchy). For those two reasons, I am giving four stars rather than five, but don't let that fool you. The food is top notch!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States

Yjb1X0z1a8OdiWlqmLjoPw.text: Finally La Condessas sister spot is open. If you love La Condessa and are on the Westside then make sure to come in. The Horchata is the best I've ever had. My favorite tacos are the chicken mole, tinga, cochinita pibil, and el gaucho. They have a huge salsa bar with tons of options.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States

imZVG8S1eEcJWCnwdoUr8A.text: In a nutshell: After 1 1/2 hr wait we left without other food in our stomachs but chips with salsa! Place was packed, 2 servers for the whole hungry crowd, our order got misplaced, and with two hungry kids next to me I had to leave to a nearby Subway. I do believe the food a the two sister facilities is great. But the service at this location is close to the worse I've ever experienced. I was happy when I got to know this place had been opened in Glendale, since we just moved to the West Valley, but unfortunately I'm not planning to come back anytime soon.

EIZmFRs6DGUZHbpaxn0hXg.text: Welcome to the neighborhood!  Had the marlin tacos and the carne asada, and they were some of the best I've had.  Great atmosphere.  They serve beer and margaritas so they are perfect as a late afternoon destination.  The salsa bar is well equipped with different tastes from all over Mexico, and the owner Felipe is a food guy at heart.  He made it a point to come over and say hi and introduce himself.  We ended the meal with a Horchata to go, and I have to say I couldn't have left any happier!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Carne asada

uQs_qp0EhTgMgqigGOiOaA.text: Best tacos in Phoenix. Trust me, in from So Cal where you can get the best Mexican food in the country. This place is AMAZING!!

KsV16W3qh60TNP52WPXufQ.text: Not impressed at all. We had seen some pretty good reviews on yelp but we were really disappointed. The food was dry and not very enjoyable. The salsa bar was nice because there were a lot of flavors to choose from but even by adding tons of salsa the food was still dry.   We won't be going here again.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. The food was bland and dry, even with tons of salsa it still was disappointing.

81dENgIYgLga3YpK1BiWqQ.text: La Santisima is not an ordinary taco shop like a hole-in-the-wall Mex restaurant. This restaurant offers vegetarian dishes on the menu. This time around, I tried the cauliflower taco, its a bit dry. But with an amazing selection of salsa and it a sure thing to make dining enjoyable. I tried the salsa La Mexicana it was  a good compliment with the taco. The variety of style and uniqueness of the food is a sure five stars!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Vegetarian taco options on the menu.
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Left: cauliflower taco, Right: fish taco

Jec0PIjn98uMQKSmT5XytA.text: I came here previously with my daughter and we really enjoyed it. So my friends came in from Chicago & I thought I would bring them here. We came right when they opened although we waited for a bit for them to open doors. We had to order at the counter. Two of us ordered the specials of 3 tacos for $8.95. The other ordered a lunch plate. Two margaritas & one beer. The total was over $80!! For lunch!! The margaritas were not as good as previously. It's such a shame. I am sorry to say we won't be back.

JDrk6qy1v2qN9ANdzcM56g.text: I thought for sure I had already reviewed this place long ago... It is, hands down, the best Mexican food I've had in Arizona. We come here at least twice every time my boyfriend is in Phoenix for Spring Training. Best tacos. Best salsa variety. Best service. Can't wait till March when I get to come back!!

ia0eaprO7iWcCnw1jz0ZQA.text: Luckily we learned about the small taco shop on Groupon. We drove past the Glendale location and we thought it was closed. Had to call to double check the hours. Once we walked in, we were greeted by the manager or owner, very welcoming. He offered us some chips and guacamole. Came to find out there was no refill on chips and we had to pay for the guacamole...  I would have liked to enjoyed some chips throughout my meal, not just the first 10 minutes. Me and my boyfriend don't drink soda, so he offered a drink we took water. He brought us the water, but in a PLASTIC CLEAR CUP. Like the ones Circle K gives you. However the tacos we ordered were AMAZING. I had the Carne Asada street tacos. They were delicious. We ate and talked. about 20 minutes later, still no waiter for a refill. I had to get up and walk to the bar for more water. Finally the check comes... we paid in cash and we had decided what the tip was going to be. The change came and the waiter/manager/owner took some of the change as his tip...   So if you can get past the bad service, getting offered something that should be free, small plastic water cups, then you'll have a great meal. We're going to go again, but to the other location.

pSD3prvktU1I56SuA-kvyA.text: My salsa prayers have been answered!! They have a ton of options for flavoring your chips, taco, or whatever delicious food you may be eating here. I tried their peanut salsa, jalapeno, chipotle, and all the others I could get my hands on. They each had their own distinct flavor and they are all uniquely amazing. I was so pleased to find a True delicious salsa bar on this side of town.  I grew up with salsas from my mom and she makes some DELICIOUS salsas. These were all so good and up to par with my mamas.   When we first got here, it was dead. But within 20 min, there was a big wait. We were lucky to have gotten there when we did. We were graciously greeted and served fresh hot chips! I ordered a coronarita and it was ok. Not the best but decent. A little too high priced for me at ten bucks. I asked the waitress what she recommended and she said the quesadillas since they are deep fried. I ordered the vegetarian one. Oh my goodness. That was the most delicious quesadilla I have ever had in my life. I probably wouldn't call them quesadillas. They were more like gorditas. But either way, AMAZING.   I look forward to coming back and tasting their tacos, tortas and burritos. And stuffing my face with more chips and twenty different Salsas. :-) can't wait!

exY62KaNPR3PWfhNtDHegg.text: La Santisima, known in a past life as La Condesa, makes some of the best...THE BEST burritos and salsas in the valley. It looks like fast casual food, but it's a sit down restaurant that costs less than competitors while offering way higher quality eats.   Like the 15+ varieties of salsa, ranging from a spicy, smoky chipotle to a light, creamy cilantro. Your food is going to take forever, so you might as well enjoy as many as you can. They all come across as very fresh--none of that canned crap.   My burrito, the Gaucho, was up there with the best I've had. And I've had a LOT of burros. The grilled white cheese, rich steak that had a faint wine flavor, cucumbers, and some peppers. Amazing. Great! The portion was huge as well, and I could barely finish it. I have a HUGE appetite.   The coolest part was that it was only around $9. That's somewhere between fast-casual and sit-down prices, but with better quality than virtually any Mexican restaurant. For about another $4 you can add some awesome aguas frescas like the horchata, complete with a touch of strawberry. I actually don't like that type of fruit infusion in something I expect to be straight up rice and cinnamon, but I can appreciate the quality ingredients.   I'm sold on this place, and I definitely recommend you should go, but that doesn't mean I'm going to overlook a few flaws that irk me. The first is that I'm not sure the furniture is either comfortable, tasteful, or clean. The high wooden tables are much obliged for taller patrons like myself, but they were sticky...despite being actively cleaned as we walked in. Gross. The seats are shoddy as well. The airbrush-on-canvas Frida Kahlo paired with the "no no THIS IS HOW MEXICAN FOOD IS DONE WE USE PROPER NAMES" motif on the menu give this a unique, yet eyeroll-worthy vibe I can best describe as try-hard and totally hipster.   Service is questionable as well. Although I appreciate that everyone who is not American actually takes their time at restaurants, I don't find anything particularly complex that warrants 20+ minutes for a burrito, and tacos/beans/rice for my dining partner. This is on top of the 10+ minutes it took to get a menu. We actually had to get up and grab them ourselves! They were not really paying attention.   Oh yeah, and then there's the warm tap water. Gross.   Anyway, Santisima comes across as a place with great cooks that don't know how to run a restaurant. I can't say I enjoyed any aspect of dining in besides salsa sampling, and so I've gotta deduct points even though that was a 5-star burrito. Fortunately, you can avoid these issues by just ordering something to go, which is probably what I'll gladly do when I undoubtedly return.

yVauZ7nNAp3Q7dj6X7T8pw.text: Drive by here all the time, based on mostly good Yelp reviews, decided to check it out.  First, their parking situation is pathetic.  Second, the service is pretty horrendous. The server was actually nice and was doing her best, but she had no help and was running the entire restaurant by herself. Seating, serving, busing all done by one overworked server. We waited 45 minutes just to get our drinks. About an hour to get out food.  Third, food is not bad, but not worth the wait.  The horchata and the salsa bar are the only saving graces to this place, but honestly it should be shut down.

Of course, enjoyed their special that day - house margaritas - they were a bit on the weak side but considering they were cheap I didn't have high expectations.  I'm sure normally they are stiffer in substance.  Enjoyed several different tacos - shrimp, carne asada, and fish - all were excellent!  Saw another customer with the quesadilla and it looked amazing - will try that another time!

oIkGvfu30-JxYJe5zgyXzQ.text: Best Mexican we've had in the Phoenix area!!  The salsa bar had a great mix of options & the street tacos were amazing. My wife had the steak quesadilla which was so tender and flavorful. I'd make this a destination for anyone looking for something great to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States

_PrrTPHkFiYSGPZfmPQ6ZA.text: This place has really good food. I love the fish tacos and the micheladas are on point. Really good variety of salsas.

p1KOhJg7AN7YsIbq3sQZgQ.text: This place was awt and delicious!!! From the service to the tacos and the salsa bar! I definitely recommend I don't have anything negative to say except try it out !!!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. This was so delicious! My favorite was the red one thrnother two we&#39;re decent. I will be back.

0A4UmLVN1ojVtzYaqVYijw.text: The horchata is worth the trip alone. I prefer the central location but this one works for the west side.  Salsa bar is good - nice roasted chili flavor in the green salsa.  I like the Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco.

jZxbFXTY9kWwuQZ1UyQFUg.text: Went here on the suggestion of a local. Quoted as the best tacos in all Arizona. I have to say I was beyond impressed. The mixed taco dinner had so many great choices, and each taco I had was fantastic. Staff was friendly and helpful with suggestions from the menu.

pYMB9TpB1zUp20RzK1JZCg.text: Regional Mexican at it's best, with something for everyone, from street tacos to mole.   Salsa bar has an overwhelming selection of thoughtful and unconventional sauces. Pecan, peanut, sesame, and strawberry to name a few.   I enjoyed cilantro, avocado, and salsa mexicana.   Shrimp mole with TOASTED (amazing) cheese for main dish, accompanied by a house margarita.   Only drawbacks were hours (close at 8) and dimly lit parking around the back.   The staff was attentive and the music was good - come for an early dinner / late lunch!

GJnL8yPxUl8w8CySj5UtCA.text: Went to this taco place over the weekend. Will not be going there again!  I had a Mexital Taco. Which essentially was a piece of avacado deep fried in potato with red and greed cabbage and a sprinkle of pico de gallo salsa! NOT GOOD!!! Tacos are suppose to be fresh, with fresh items not fried!!! The beans and rice where good.  The place was small and tables seemed to be placed in odd places! The chairs had rips in the fabrics. Not a very welcoming environment. Parking was awful!  Had to park in the empty lot in the back of the designated parking lot! This is not an establishment I will return to. I rather go to Taco Bell! YIKES!

JLR5Xe5zJYqYbMw1mfKhZA.text: This place has good food and huge portions. My wife and I often split an order. The quesadillas are unique. Not diet food, but good for a splurge. Unique offerings and my wife loves the margaritas.

k1Zi5JsG-Tz4U4BXLd63hQ.text: Best selection if tacos I have ever seen.  Each is very unique and tasty.  Highly recommend for something different in tacos.

gkCwkfEmmUWgE9mIy3MItQ.text: Very hip , cool art everywhere and their food is very fresh with some unique recipes& options.Cool Vegetarian "street tacos" too . The mole tacos were a real standout among the many types we sampled. We each picked 3 different tacos so we sampled 6 kinds  of taco. Despite enjoying the tacos and beer.....We really felt both the tacos (around$5 each)and micheladas (over$10)were so much more expensive than we usually pay for such "treats" it was hard to feel it was "worth it" overall .

rsnNPNHtFG8crhxveglsuw.text: La Santisima is a Mexican Restaurant with a unique menu that features many tacos some interesting and hard to find Mexican Foods like the Stuffed Chili with Walnut Sauce and the Mexican version of stuffed calzones called Quesa. Another one of the other unique features is  a very large salsa bar that has about 15-20 different salsas to try. The restaurant offers indoor and outdoor seating and it's done in a really cool Day of the Dead kind of theme. This location is in Old Town Glendale and they have their own parking lot.  I've been here a couple times since my first visit and a few things I loved before have been slightly different so I have to get that out there.  The Marlin Taco I had on my first visit tasted very similar to the Marlin Tacos I had in Mexico. They have a unique smoked flavor and were delicious with a similar flavor. On my most recent visit the Marlin Taco was still good but lacked the smoked taste and had little flavors on it's own. It was still good and packed with a very generous amount of filling but not the same.  I also tried the Whitefish taco. It was also packed with a generous amount of crispy battered fish and lots of cabbage dressed with a very mild cilantro dressing. It was good but also needed to be kicked up with things from the salsa bar. I added a squirt of lime juice, a little cilantro salsa and some strawberry salsa and then it was really tasty.  For me and the majority of people out there two tacos is all you can eat because they are double shelled and fully packed.  My husband had a three taco platter that comes with rice and refried beans. He got a pork taco, chicken tinga and a brisket taco that was grilled. The most perfect and favorite taco was the Chicken Tinga. It was very flavorful and made with moist dark chicken meat. The brisket had good flavors but it was stringy.  We were both really full so we took out a vegetable quesa (like a calzone but the dough is made with masa and it might be fried) to have latter because the quesa is usually really delicious and is a treat here. I don't remember what vegetables came in it on past visits but this time it was mostly just onions. I did find traces of spinach and mushrooms but it was filled with mostly onions and cheese and was still a tasty treat but it wasn't the same.  I still really like this place and service was ok too but some things aren't up there where they were before so I had to get it out there.  3 stars according to Yelp means A-OK

O6IogMWGBd0zWVT4tdk6JQ.text: There is no comparison to the quality and uniqueness of this restaurant. This is by far the west valleys pride and joy. Crazy good salsa bar and menu. Honestly who doesn't want to try a shark taco or vegan cheese fried taco. Metabolism favorite is the quesadilla.

2Anwa9uz7oxB7avM1A_0hA.text: Excellent.  You could never get tired of the large variety of salsas--that seem to change every time I come in.  The menu is overwhelming and the food is top notch.  They also have excellent margaritas that are really inexpensive during happy hour.  The staff is friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Cool painting near bar

UlnzcMqwVrMaAChH2pk4hA.text: Starting off with the food... it wasn't bad, but it also wasn't outstanding. Nothing that would make me drive to this place in specific to satisfy my Mexican food craving. I got a torta/lonche and street tacos and everything was okay.   The customer service was what brings this from what could have been a 4 star review to a 2 star. We were not attended properly. We had asked for 2 items on the side and never got them... told the waiter and he only brought back 1 thing. I had to go up to the counter to ask for the last item. We never once got a drink refill or got checked up on until the check came. It wasn't busy that day and the waiters were just standing around so being occupied wasn't an excuse. It took so long to receive food and the check. Another couple there got there after us and also left after us, which meant that fast service could have been done. Once time came around to pay, I had asked the server if he could split the check and he stated it was too much work and that he had already input it into the system, which made it so difficult. I ended up paying $40 for a 2 entree lunch, which was extremely overpriced and not worth it.

aq1c5ei1x4dTqzCgBoM37Q.text: This is a petty good hidden gem that sits on a Main Street. Found this place on diners drives and dives. They were famous for their tacos and salsas.   The decor is very nice. The chairs are comfy and they have a wall with bench seating which is very cool a gets a thumbs up from me. They have beautiful paintings on the walls. They have a small bar with a good selection of hard alcohol, wine and beer. They also have a outside patio which is pretty large.   The food was pretty good. We ordered our tacos a la carte because we wanted to try different ones. The street tacos have a good amount of meat in them. Not skimpy like most places. And we also ordered one of the signature tacos and they are big. No wonder why they are $4+ a taco lol.   Over all this place is a nice place to hang out at. I can see them having a great taco Tuesday. My reasoning for only giving them 4 stars is because I can't give half of a star. The reason for hall a star off Is because they serve can drinks instead of fountain. I hate when a restaurant gives you can sodas.

lRkL1QmgPvvDrr7MA6R6-Q.text: I eat here all the time. There is no other taco that can even compare. The service here is amazing. They staff are so friendly and welcoming. I have been coming here regularly for years and have never had an issue. Everything I've had on the menu is phenomenal so I wouldn't even know what to suggest as it's all so good!

QiJikbbzG6bUOk_a7vyypg.text: We went to this place on Sunday around 12:20, and they only had one server. We could place the order 40min after we got the seats. How come do they have one server on Sunday? Waitress never came to take the order, so many people just left. Ordered horchata, and it was the worst horchata ever. They have various kinds of salsas, but tastes are just fine. Nothing really special. Price is little bit higher than other Mexican restaurants. I Do Not recommend this place.

hhPmUPknhiJRsvllBZGWaw.text: This location has much potential however do not expect any type of service here, the burro arabe was delicious but besides that my experience her was subpar. I wanted to visit this place because of the great salsa bar I had read about but once I was there, the salsa bar was sad and low stocked. None of the salsas looked fresh either.   However, the fact that there's no customer service or organization of any kind, that is what ruins this place.   Wish it was better, would be such an awesome place.

8EF3kJNsr-ylyEIgJKac_Q.text: My husband and I drove out to Glendale to wander the shops and discovered that many of them are closed on Sunday. Oh well, we were hungry so made that our priority! We got out our phones and decided to check Yelp reviews for a good Mexican restaurant. La Santisima Gourmet Tacos popped up:)  We were welcomed immediately when we entered and received outstanding service. The restaurant has a cool vibe with colorfully striped chairs and large, vibrant paintings of Frida, Diego, images of Dia de Los Muertos and other iconic images.   A lot of Mexican restaurants have salsa bars, but not with this many freshly made salsas and in such flavorful varieties. We had to stop ourselves from eating chips so we would have room for our lunch! I tried the combination plate of three street tacos with rice and beans. All were fantastic, but the spicy pork was my favorite! My husband had a quesadilla that he raved about. And he grew up in AZ, so he is picky about Mexican food! We'll definitely return...with friends:)

V4cqBFgMnVkkxpp5HSLHsA.text: My buns and and I went around 1:30 pm and it was not busy, nice atmosphere, delicious food and $5 Tuesday margaritas? Perfect! The food was delicious and I would definitely come back when back in town :)
