QcMcm0ae4XIsWCm0ZW_boA.text: Really good service, really good food and the Best Mango Margarita I have ever tasted. Highly recommend place to eat.   P.S the paintings they have are amazing.

Jxnsp6c6v5bj-e038O3lTw.text: Wow.  Mind, stomach and taste buds blown.  Mexican is my favorite cuisine and hands down La Santisima is the best Mexican food and carne asada I've ever had.  I'm still craving it -- it's that good!    I'm a Southern California native and am blessed with great Mexican food, but La Santisima is a different category.  They serve Tex-Mex and their quesas (their version of a quesadilla) -- straight foodgasm in my mouth.  I just wish we had more time in Az this time around to go back and try their fish tacos.  (Yes, it was that good that I would've gone back consecutive days!)  So many salas to choose from, all were spicy but delicious and peanut was my favorite.  Thanks for upping the bar and you've made the quesa my last wish meal.  Can't wait to be back --- or open up in Cali, haha.

ptE-Z9AhHe4_ptzS4_qPVw.text: I've driven by La Santisima many times but never stopped in. The decor on the outside intrigued me so I Yelped it and was impressed by the reviews. We decided to give it a shot on my moms birthday with a party of 5. We were seated quickly got our chips and drinks and started trying the various salsas from the salsa bar. It was pretty cool having more than a few choices and some were really good.  There is almost to much on the menu. All 5 of us had a hard time deciding on what to sample. I decided to go with the shark quesa. It did not disappoint. It was great. All 5 of us enjoyed our food immensely and were talking about when we could get together to go back.   The service was good. Not great but the one waitress was pretty taxed because of how busy they were. We ordered my daughters quesa with no sour cream and it came out with sour cream. It was noticed by the waitress as soon as she put put it down though and she took care of it. My wife's tacos and my daughters quesa were brought out quite a bit later than the other 3 meals. No clue why the tacos took so long but it is what it is. Also it took a bit of effort to get the chips refilled and I still haven't got my drink refilled.   Notice I've mentioned that we had a party of 5 quite a few times... La Santisima automatically adds 18% gratuity to parties 6 or above. Well when we got our bill it was marked as a party of 6, with gratuity added. The waitress took my card, ran it, and low and behold the itemized copy that showed the added gratuity was gone when she brought the customer/store copies back. You know, that's the part when you fill in the tip. If I wouldn't have noticed beforehand I would not have had any idea that the tip was already included. Because we didn't have a party of 6, only 5. I kind of felt like someone was trying to get over on me and get double tipped. Just a suspicion. I don't tend to be the conspiracy theory type but it just seemed a bit fishy to me.   I would definitely go back. The food was fantastic, 5 star territory, but the service snafus and the gratuity mystery cost them a couple stars. When I do go back, and I will, I'm just going to keep a really close eye on my receipt.

38ULu25eM9bx_Xj_FmR7nA.text: Dear La Condesisima or whoever you are now...I don't need to add to the already glowing reviews of your food, I love it and hope you stay around forever (especially your chile oil...I could drink that stuff).  In fact, I love it so much that I frequently crave it on my way home from work....but I am almost always thwarted by the fact that no one ever answers the phone to take my order. I'm not going to stop and wait for you to take and make my order when I'm trying to bring dinner home to my kids, I just want to order over the phone so I can walk in and pick it up.   Please answer your phone so I can spend my money at your place.  (unless you're trying to discourage take-out orders, in which case please tell me so I can stop getting my hopes up when the craving strikes!)   Thanks!

ORuPQnq9N2OtpCGyXzJRcA.text: Just as good as the original location.  I recommend the cochinita pibil tacos and a horchata.  The salsas are very tasty.  The place was dead when I came so hopefully more people will come to check it out.  It is a little pricey but it is worth it.  It is much better than La Perla next door.  BLAH.  No idea how that place is still around.    Check out La Santisima if you are near by.

FI85aFTiKS-321Hvn3j-7A.text: Based off the salsa and margarita I'm in love. My food isn't even out yet and I'm a happy girl. Fresh quality taste. Service is great although my mom and I are the only people here. I will definitely be updating after I eat my quesadilla. Yummy yum

mxLb4s25Yafi0xRt8M-0rg.text: The food was great. Huge servings. But sadly the service was not good. Maybe a few more waitresses would help?

uDlnRkgk1E1sS-i6QIcNtg.text: I'm from out of town and happened to see this restaurant on Diner's Drive In's & Dive's, and it was just as good as Guy said it was!!! The food is ridiculously good, super unique but still authentic. You have to wait for a while to get the food, but it's so worth it because of the quality. Make sure to try the Horchata.

rlm5MlxYSv0agXvt7HVmrg.text: Finally visited La Santisima.  Thought I would really really like the food, but I didn't.  Although I did finish my plate, it wasn't spectacular in any way.  Before I get to what I ordered, let me make note on how important it is for a restaurant to have an eye soothing menu.  The online menu is great, but the restaurant menu is much more extensive than the short list on the website.    Unfortunately for me, the menu was much too busy.  The colors were awful and I didn't want to look at it for more than two minutes.   Red and black text looked crammed and didn't stand out the way text on a decently designed menu does.  I barely read past the tacos.    Ordered three tacos a la carte ($3.99 each). The mesquite cactus taco (I can't remember the dish name) with no queso, La Condesa Veggie with no queso, and the fish taco.  Also a side of guac which cost about $4.  Honestly the guac was the most exciting thing on the table. The food was filling but all three tacos needed some DIY spicing.  Ranking: 1. guacamole - made with dried cranberries and mango.  A bit tangier than I prefer, but palatable. 2. spinach taco - wished the spinach was chopped smaller 3. cactus taco - slabs of cactus made my mouth work overtime  4. fish taco - too much breading on the fish, and just plain cabbage with bland white sauce drizzled on top.  Wish I had asked for no white sauce.   The salsa bar is okay.  There were only a few salsas that I thought looked appetizing.  Most were watery and needed some DIY mixing of two or three to get a fantastic flavor.  And with the serving cups being so small, I couldn't grab a decent serving of a favorite salsa.  I refilled at the bar three times and then just gave up.  Our server was kindhearted and brought a sample of horchata.  I have tasted something similar to it, but didn't like it.  Sweet drinks with cinnamon flavor aren't my thing.  If I'm in the area and feeling hungry I would go back.  It's a decent restaurant, but not one to where I would plan a night out.

ExjTDPNclZIL9x63sK0wAg.text: Excellent food, excellent service The restaurant is always clean and presentable. The owners are very warm and welcoming. Lots of different salsas to choose from. Fantastic horchata (probably the best i've ever had)  Tacos are amazing!!

tsRdKlPtNYYiO53jmgw8WA.text: This is an awesome, quaint artsy restaurant nestled just slightly off the Historic Glendale strip with a casual vibe and truly delicious food.   We visited on a quiet night and had attentive service, since we were the only other guests other than a large family gathering in the center. The number of patrons, however, is no reflection on the food or experience.   We split two, two-taco plates for maximum sampling--chicken black mole, la santisma with shrimp, chicken tinga, and pork pibil...all of which were delicious. The la santisma, loaded with veggies and cheese was the overall winner (and was the one recommended by our waiter). Also, being a mole fan, I was excited to eat a REALLY good mole!   I only wish there was one closer, because I would eat here wayyyy to often. The salsa bar is out of this world if you are a salsa nut like myself. Sooo many options, all for the tasting. Ever had a delish jicama and cilantro salsa? How about the less common radish salsa, which was outstanding? Not to mention the other 10+ salsas on the bar, including a spicy guac. Many of these have quite the kick, so this may not be for the faint of heart.   Lastly, the house margarita was tasty and we both loved the mixed citrus, including lemons, limes, orange and grapefruit. This is not a "knock-you-on-your-a$$" bev, but probably the tastiest mixed drink I've had in a long time. So fresh, crisp and well-made for enjoyment.   I will be making the trip back again and again. Yum...

4_9Mo0O2M7clwkkyd6MKHQ.text: La Santisima is easily one of the best taco shops in the Phoenix area. The menu is fresh and interesting,  with dishes taken from various areas in southern Mexico. If you want to try new and authentic flavors, this is the place.   It's simple and unique, with a minimal staff and barebones table settings, but you somehow feel a sense of "rightness". It's no frills, no fluff, just great Mexican food for a price you can't match. I'd rather pay 9 bucks for an amazing burrito and eat my salsa out of a plastic bowl than visit a snazzy upscale place with food that's no better but have to shell out twice the price.   Go. To. La. Santisima.

IptnNMxHHKGa8hVZlTtcPg.text: We will NEVER return. This was a TERRIBLE, AWFUL experience from beginning to end...service, food, everything has taken me from a patron who took out-of-towners here, to someone who will NEVER return to this location. Biggest offense - serving beef in the veggie tacos and burros - more than once to the same table, and other tables.  The scene: Friday evening ~6:30 pm. There are six 4-tops available, a long both (seating ~15) reserved with no one there yet, all but 1 table unoccupied on the patio, and the long table with 6-8 seats left. In other words, they were not full, no one ever waited for a table to finish before being seated. Despite this, the hostess (and waitress) looked around curiously wondering where to seat us? Anywhere would have worked, and so we were seated. As is custom, we quickly received tortilla chips and were welcomed to the salsa bar.  However, 20 minutes passed before our waitress returned to take our drink order. Based on this, we also placed our entree order. The waitress either has issues with getting the orders correct, or just likes to correct guest annunciations. For instance, the menu says quesa, so we say quesa and she has to repeat oh you mean quesadilla? Not sure why but we rolled with it.   Another 5-10 minutes pass before everyone's drinks arrived (and some of the salsas are very spicy!). We had to ask for waters and were served warm water in clear plastic 12 ou solo cups. The table next to us actually received iced water in real glasses with beautiful blue rims.   We witnessed another table receive their food, only to have half the food removed before two new entrees appeared They were served the wrong items. Huh. Kinda weird. That happened to me last time we were there, but they caught it before I could even take a bite. These people had begun eating and had to point out to the staff that there were issues. Wanna know the issues? BEEF in the VEGAN tacos. How did we find that out you may ask? Guess!  So, after at least 15 minutes (all our drinks are empty and were never asked if we wanted another cerveza or margarita or even sip of water), two of our four dinner entrees were served. Here's where I believe you Yelpers probably have guessed it - one of those was a VEGAN burro - served with BEEF! When we mentioned this to the waitress 7 minutes later refilling the tables drink order next to us. She apologized and mentioned that happened at another table too. She returned with a new (not grilled, kinda gross looking) burro.  Apparently there was a new chef. Yes, let's blame everything on him! More time passes and my entree (taco plate) contained a veggie la santisima taco (missing several listed ingredients such as onions and spinach) but only with cheese, mushrooms, and peppers, and BEEF! Yes there was beef on this too. Not much, but at least one piece is something suppose to be meat free. My shrimp cabo was SPECIFICALLY requested without sauce and it was covered. The waitress actually asked me if I could just pick it off. No, I cannot because the sauce is touching all the cheese and cabbage and I paid for an entire taco. The beans and rice were horrible too, the rice tasted plain, no flavor with bland corn. The beans tasted like watered down gruel - no taste, no seasoning. And last time - I devoured the beans and rice because they were tasty. No amount of salsa bar could fix these tastes today.  So, how about that fourth entree? After the first two people FINISHED their entire meal (one Churro in the Quesa section) then the 4th entree appeared. What about that replaced veggie burro - BEEF in it AGAIN!  You can blame a chef for mixing up orders at a table. But, can you continue blaming the chef when you serve the wrong food to every table? We watched as 2 more tables received incorrect entrees. Oh, and the large party arrived after our troubles began. I can't forgive a wait staff that doesn't know how to handle these situations-wrong food, long wait times, inconsistent timing, beef served to vegetarians. You cannot serve vegetarians meat in the burro - twice. Come on now! Why are all the veggie la satisima missing half the ingredients and containing meat?????   There were some rushed apologies, but no call to action. Asking me if I'd like another taco after we pay is more like salt on the wound than a bandaid. I loved this place our first visit. We couldn't wait to take our parents here. We REGRET deeply what they had to endure and wish to warn others that the salsa bar is NOT worth all the other troubles. We were charged for all the food - even the food that couldn't be eaten (Shrimp cabo, Veggie Burro) and for food that appeared after most people finished their meal at our table of four.   We will NEVER, EVER return to this location and cannot think of how the manager would even attempt to rectify this situation.

ahqTZhbU5TB6424YJEWVKg.text: We almost did not enter as the place was empty about 7pm, but I had read about the 16 salsa's and we pushed forward just as one other car pulled into the dimly lit parking lot. The Mexican restaurant next door was packed, so we probably should have went over there. This regional brand of Mexican food might appeal to non-gringos as most of the food was quite unusual and hot and some food was just downright bad. The 1/2 order of guac had large chunks of avocado, but also has raisins and a liquidy kind of taste. It was not what you would expect in a normal Mexican joint. The steak tacos I ordered had to be sent back due to excessive fatty pieces and the chicken tinga tacos were way too spicy for a normal palette. The spicy theme continued as nearly all 16 salsa's had a version of heat that ran too hot. This was a sweaty experience, so gringo's stay away. On a positive note, the pregnant waitress was very nice and helpful.

Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Fatty Steak tacos
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Strange guacamole

8FgPM6--LuwFdS9iLk5aYw.text: Been here a total of 4 times and I want to make it my 5th as soon as I can. So this was easy for me to update my rating from 4 stars to 5 stars!  I still love my tacos but my wife recently had the argentine steak quesadilla and it was amazing!! It was very big..big enough for us to easily share. On our last visit we didn't share but ended up taking the other half home and have an amazing snack!  Overall service isn't the fastest, but I'll wait a little for food so good. Nice local restaurant in Glendale!

TimBjP3OG1np5yV7V9apCw.text: Delicious! :-) There are so many salsas to try.  Each one is so good.  The street tacos are great.  I tried 3 flavors but found the chicken mole...now, that's my favorite if all. Great prices.  Service very good.   I can't say enough except..go check it out.:-)

Nh7kc9ouVwClyMMhxKS4ww.text: I have been here twice and both visits were enjoyable.  The food is amazing and the portions are generous.  It is fun to order and share among friends since there is such a variety on the menu - definitely many flavors to suit every palate.  The salsa bar is eclectic and amusing and brings a great point of conversation to the table.  This is a great addition to downtown Glendale.  I was disappointed by the slow service provided at both visits.  The staff plays music from an mp3/iPod but we had to ask several times to turn it down because we could not even here each other talk over the volume of the music.  It was a feature that I could have done without.  These are easy fixes for the management and staff.

cZtmuSffubEp8gXDxXthbg.text: Food is very good. I had the al pastor quesadilla which is unbelievable. The service was slow and waiter a bit grumpy but the food is worth coming back for.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Al pastor quesadilla is phenomenal

aNTLohRZMgqKcNOcbgiKGw.text: I love this taco shop!! The salsa bar was great with so many options to choose from. The employees were very friendly too.  I had the pastor Quesa and it was amaizing!

G_ioegV6qNZiJKkwb3qPMA.text: My best friend first suggested we go here for the strawberry salsa, which is amazing.  I love tacos, but as a vegetarian, I hardly ever get to eat them. They have a few different types of vegetarian tacos here.

gzPyaPMylJvF3Dq4a2HZyQ.text: We ordered pick up the other night from la santisima. We arrived and it was just being put together so we had margaritas which used to be great... they have since started using brand x margarita mix where they  used to squeeze fresh citrus.  The real problem with this place is the inconsistency I asked for them to make sure the order is proper because I do drive 50 minutes round trip to get get there food which I believe is some of the best in the area. I got home and opened the order and it was incorrect we ordered 8 tacos a quesadilla and. The correct items where the quesadillas 2 tacos and the guacamole. I called immediately upon  opening the wrong food and they asked me to bring it back I let them know that's not a possibility and I informed them what was wrong and asked if they could just credit my Amex. They said no and that there manager would call me to review the issue. Well they haven't so hopefully this review will garner attention so I can speak to them about there awful customer service and inconsistency. After being a valued customer for 6 years including the location at 16th street I will no longer come here and I will stop telling people to go here. It's unfortunate but it's the truth this place went straight into the gutter.

X0RRBjoGS04t4l6qbdAplQ.text: Tried them on a whim in passing by today, it was just ok. .my carne was well seasoned and flavorful,  my pork was horrible, they screwed my order up only to correct it...then when i got home I realized it was still screwed up...  My total for 3 tacos, small rice & beans came to $14 and some change, I don't think it was quite worth that but i may be inclined to try them again - at someone else's expense. I'm a little salty that I didnt check groupon before going lol.

I can't see even a picture of those plates because will make me sick again. We ask for burritos and the meat inside looks like a canning meat, the taste wasn't impressive. m8pdIk9P9cG3Ei-GR7w_OA.text: Amazing salsa,  seriously. This place has redefined delicious Mexican food for me.  Great music,  great ambiance, great drinks,  great food.

O9B-HdjHTmvDG8pf89_xnQ.text: An airport shuttle driver recommended this restaurant, as it was fairly close to the Thunderbird School of Global Management, where I was headed for the week.  Though, in reality, it feels like nothing is close to anything in Phoenix.  She said that she sends people there regularly, and she gets good feedback from those she sends.  One of the things I loved about it: it's not just another Tex-Mex restaurant pretending to represent the cuisine of this vast country called Mexico.  Their menu features dishes from all around Mexico and unless you can't break your non-adventurous self from burritos, then you'll probably experience something new and delicious.    By the way, our party of four did not experience any of the others' comments about poor service.  The young woman who served us was prompt, cheerful, courteous, attentive, and was happy to take a group photo of us using my phone. She was even rather easy on the eyes for us four men.  I'd recommend the place.

CLCKpocn8lQ4OqqDQ9DADg.text: This place is awesome the pastor tacos are delicious. The homemade salsa bar is authentic and has something for everybody. Would recommend this place if you like good Mexican food especially the street tacos.

bAgBGBOXDVteCbF-hX-rYA.text: I ordered La Condesa shrimp burrito and it was delicious. jC0I26LLlaxQlox8jOF3Uw.text: I had heard a lot about this place and was excited to try it. Went for lunch on a Sunday, wasn't too busy. Was promptly seated and brought chips and order was taken. Very nice salsa bar with a lot of different salsas and big vegetarian menu. I ordered 3 different vegetarian tacos. 40 minutes later, food had still not arrived. By the time it finally did, the food looked great, until I noticed there were 3 pieces of hair in my food. Ended up leaving hungry. Can't believe that after a nearly a 50 minute wait, I was served food with hair in it. Will not be back.

ZxDBs4ut4WGjqr-ykZOxPQ.text: Dropped by La Santisima on a Friday afternoon around 1:00 pm to grab a late lunch. Initially, I had a bit of a hard time finding the place, but it was bit easier to see once I located the parking lot behind it. There was plenty of seating inside and we were given water and a giant bowl of chips after we were seated. In terms of food, I literally cannot start talking about anything else before I rave about the salsa bar. There are literally 10+ selections of salsa from guacamole salsa to sesame salsa and more typical salsas like salsa verde. I went berserk getting a bunch of the salsas and tried a good deal of them. It also helped that they gave us a giant heaping pile of chips to try all the salsa with.   In terms of actual food, I got the La Santisima Veggie taco and the Mexica Ahuacatl taco. My friend on the other hand had the 3 taco plate with rice and beans. Both of the tacos I ordered were guuureat though I did like the La Santisima Veggie taco a lot more than the Mexica Ahuacatl. I did steal a bite of my friend's rice and beans and it was also super delicious! My friend enjoyed all 3 of his tacos (2 meat, 1 fish) even though his order was slightly incorrect. Overall, the food was great and service was good. The only downside was that they didn't have the guacamole when we went! Definitely need to go back and try it!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Enfrijolada quesa
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States

GmOEhb7vga-jdf9udnOj0g.text: Good tacos. Slow service.  And the room was a bit awkwardly arranged.  I think there  were a couple of kids in their first date, frying like a couple of insects underneath the south facing window.  The salsa bar didn't disappoint.

OspC_7aPlCExOtLwRVIG6A.text: When we first walked in it was a really welcoming vibe, the waitress was really friendly and the service was fast. The drinks were amazing! I can't express how good the drinks were. The tacos were not bad but felt that they were over powered by the vegetation, but once all that was clear it was game on. The best taco was the chorizo and potatoes, there was a lot of flavor and soaked all of the taste buds. Will definitely come back for more. Keep cookin la santisma!

The pecan salsa was also good.   Now the bad. Was told that they ran out of carne asada.  And it was 5pm on a Friday!   Very unacceptable!   Only like ten different salsas out of the advertised 20. c5MSu0t3s9q_4fViPwTi5Q.text: Oh, La Santisima. I had this placed bookmarked as one of the places to check out when I was in town. I knew about the downtown location, however due to the parking and the location I was pretty iffy about it. When I learned that there was a second location with a private parking lot behind the shop, I jumped at it. I came here with some coworkers that were hungry for something new so as always they accompanied me in my food adventures.  So let's see, this building is right off a main road and it basically looks like a house. I got a little lost and turned a street early and had to get back on the road to turn again.  Inside the restaurant there were a lot of portraits of Dia de muertos (Day of the Dead) artwork and other artworks such as Luchadores on the walls which I thought was very interesting and it's something that I usually see when you go to a Mexican restaurant. It gives the restaurant an identity and something memorable when I think of the restaurant. There's indoors and outdoor seating, we sat inside as it was getting dark and it was still 100 degree weather outside.  I ordered the Al Pastor Burrito, which I can say wasn't really on the menu because I basically asked for it and wanted to see what they had. They obliged, and when it came out it was different as it had pineapples in it which was pretty interesting. I think even if they left out the pineapple, it would've been tasty. It was good. The restaurant also sported a full salsa bar, and you could get as much as you wanted and there were so many options. I didn't really use it other than to add some heat to the burrito. However, this burrito was pretty awesome, and one of the best that I had when I was in Phoenix (out of the limited amount of places I went to).  The Mahi Pastor Taco, was just okay. This was ordered after I finished the burrito, and we were just talking. Why not keep eating? So, the taco was pretty simplistic which wasn't bad, but I think it lacked a little bit of flavor. There wasn't really any special about it, but I keep thinking about the burrito. So if you're deciding to get this taco compared to the other ones, I say pass on this as you're probably missing anything.  And well, a margarita is a margarita. Nothing unusual or special there.  Overall, it was great. I think I would come back here if I was in town. The amount of food that you got compared to other places were comparable. We came here on a pretty empty night so the service was pretty good. I can't say for all times during the day, but my experience it wasn't bad.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Mahi Pastor Taco
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Margarita
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Al Pastor Burrito

4cer66buUotTk3ihFOCUeQ.text: La Santisima could hold its own in any city. In Glendale, this place is a shining beacon of food  goodness. It's a temple of deliciousness in a culinary scene of soggy white bread. The guy recommended the tacos. They were all tasty, and the burnt cheese on top really sealed the deal. Yum! Definitely worth a return trip.  As a bonus, it's next to a drive through liquor store, which seems like it should not be entirely legal.

6ifKTuCWIFwpas73hZFNYA.text: Love the salsa bar! The food is unique and tasty. The horchata is must they put fresh nuts and goodies inside.

BRdwcTPGbHgj1VEMCbVdJQ.text: We had a fabulous lunch here today. They had my favorite strawberry salsa in the salsa bar today which I think it more of a summer thing, it is so good. All of the salsas on the bar are so good. I also had the veggie tacos with mushrooms, poblano, Oaxaca cheese, onions, spinach and olive oil. They are to die for. When my mom visits she always needs to come here. She is low carb and loves the protein style tacos that are available. A local gem.

aph9XW-3L2XgcVMM-1Dv2Q.text: Guy Fieri was right. This place makes the best mole sauce under the sun. I've tried three of their dishes that feature mole sauce, and every one was different, and spectacularly good. The tacos mole are my favorite of all time.   Their guacamole, featuring mango chunks and raisins, is addictive. And yeah, most of the salsas are hot, but they're made for adventures. Hot strawberry salsa? To die for! If you're the tame type, try the cilantro, or pecan salsas. Both are fairly bland.   I also love the decor and service. Lovely paintings by talented Latin American artists, sculptures indoors and out, a pleasant, cheerful wait staff -- what more can you ask for? My wife and I had lunch there last week, and both of us left stuffed to the gills. All told, our appetizer, two entrees, soft drinks, and salsa plus chips, set us back only $25. This place is totally amazing.

9adyMeUBcns24vSaIdKqKg.text: We love eating here when we come in town!  The street tacos are perfect, they definitely compete with what we eat back home in San Diego.  Service is sometimes slow, but they are polite and friendly.

v_gXX4ZaaQmODT8OaBKz8w.text: Once you get inside you now you are getting into a nice Mexican food experience.  Food is nicely presented in authentic Mexican plates and utensils. Got coliflor burro and queso fundido...and a beer

yk9XyjByghmGXRt_84jvEw.text: Best choice of tacos from different regions of Mexico! They even have vegetarian and vegan tacos! The simple bean burrito (bullet burro) is to die for. My favorite option they have is that you can order the tacos "protein style" where they come literally wrapped in ooey delicious Oaxacan cheese-- keto friendly if you stick to the meats etc! Homemade salsa bar with 8-12 different salsas. And holy balls, do yourself a favor and order an horchata. It's like nothing I've ever had before and I want to be submerged in it when I die. So. Good. I'm craving it now, as I review.   The atmosphere and staff attitude is a little lax but I don't go to a restaurant for that-- it's all about the food.

JtDtpte5F3zHpVUBnsqi1Q.text: I have to say that this place is amazing! Horchata rocks Service during lunch time on 12/19/2017 by one server was exceptional Salsa bar was exciting and fun to try all the different ones. Food was so good! I was nervous about the white rice they brought out. But it had more flavor than most Spanish style rice I have had. You have to try it..Just don't go during my lunch time so I can find my own table. Giggle*

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Horchata, not to sweet. They have added some fresh yummy bits.... nuts, cantaloupe and strawberries

hKnBOXMrXcuM-ycmQ7bPPw.text: Wait was a little long but the food is worth the wait. Make sure to make your presence be known because people will try to cut you off in line.

8aGqZir9Z6lxm5w-v7uyzg.text: Dinner at La Santisima is becoming a Friday night tradition and I have to say I'm pretty happy about it! My husband has become obsessed with this place. If it were up to him we would be here at least 3 days a week. We had no idea this place was on Trippe D we just knew Jason V. and many of my fellow yelp friends really liked this place. We decided to give it a try and now it's our go to spot. Not only do they have some really great taco's as advertised but their, burritos, salsa's, margarita's, and horchata are some of the best I've ever had. So far my very favorites have been their Cabo Shrimp Taco: Corn tortilla stuffed with beer battered shrimp. Shrimp was giant, crispy, and tasty. Their Green Chili burrito and their horchata! I usually dont like horchata at all but this one is addicting. It is topped with a drizzles of caramel, strawberries, and pecans and you can just taste that it's home made. We have a had great service, and I find it strange that there has never been a wait. But hey I'll take it, more for me!! We recently brought my mom and her husband here and they too loved it. So I will be seeing you next Friday!!

ePPQkqyyLAVxGdWvzkh6CA.text: Great Mexican food!! The tiger shrimp tacos are OMG delicious!! They also have a great margarita selection... this is a must for anyone who loves Mexican food!!

OVnHZgx3i3cBVOVqLyqSiQ.text: Well the horchata was ok.  I guess the first issue.. ordered street tacos a la carte that were supposed to be 1.95 but somehow they decided the bring out the plate w/ rice and beans because this was supposed to save money.. well it didn't.. I didn't ask them too.. but hey.. thanks i guess lol.  Stay away from the carne asada tacos. The meat is poor quality.. too much fat and it makes for a greasy taco..this in my opinion is a pretty bad asada taco. The mountain of cabbage doesn't help it's overall lacking in flavor either. Pile on the salsa, those are really good. Also it's reheated which is standard practice i guess but some of these pieces were pretty black.. living in a mexican household you know this happens when you reheat the meat a few times. I could not tell the difference between the street taco and the more expensive arrachera taco. Meat quality = same.  Burro was solid. Salsa's great.. no chip refills. All in all for 70 bucks.. not worth it. That's 12 tacos rice and beans, 1 burrito, and 5 drinks.. this at Los Taquitos would cost me $40ish. However those tacos are ridiculous good unlike here.  Don't get what the fuzz is all about.

FIX8ijtXMwzVujmX3CgJaA.text: Service is terrible. Asked 3x for tequila suggestions and got nothing.  People waiting out the door with 4 open tables.  Food is great just plan to wait.  AND I ordered a burro to go with FISH And was given beef.  Horrible!!   No mas!

s50Nqu9d75_8vJN5DUgHgg.text: I was so high on this place by all the great reviews, sad to say is that the majority of these people don't know great tasting meat, well, whatever small portion I received. I ordered the al pastor burro and was disappointed, little meat with alot of al pastor sauce, and to much secret sauce. I like the whole concept of mixing spicy with sweet as I got chunks of pineapple in my burro, as stated on the menu. And my michelada also came with a sweet and spicy rim, which i loved. The michelada was delicious but a bit pricy, $18.00 for two. Overall I was disappointed, would I go back? Sure, just for a couple drinks.

4SBxuQV6kO2GZqo4Y6Bn0Q.text: I loved this place!! They have an awesome salsa bar, my favorite was the mexican salsa, it had a nice little kick to it. The waiter's are so kind and had awesome service. I got the 3 taco plate which comes with rice and beans. And i am not really a bean liking person, but something about their beans had me eating them till gone. Their rice was unique too!! -mpxhWE4vEmdsjz-mkoIIw.text: This place is good but I hate that they don't have fountain drinks and they go by can of soda. Also the last time I went the waitress took forever to order our food and helped another table before us that got there after us.

4fh7bMs_wrL8PpA4Txx3tA.text: My experience here left me willing to try it again, though it didn't live up to expectations.  I came in by myself at dinner time. I was promptly seated and provided with chips. The server was by herself handling the entire dining room and bar at supper, and as a solo diner, I was last priority. It took me all of two minutes to choose what I wanted--a single taco--but it took fifteen minutes for my order to be taken. If I hadn't been given the chips, I would have given up and left. In the meantime, I saw people who came in after me get complete service because they ordered drinks.  The chips were excellent--very fresh. I like the salsa bar but the lighting was poor back there so it was hard to see what was what.  Finally a male server joined her and he took my order. My Aztec chicken tinga taco came out about five minutes later. It was excellent. The chicken was very tender and tasty. Just the right about of spice. It only took about five minutes to catch the server's eye and soon enough I was on my way.

LNlQa_O6N1EY_bFxYy35Sw.text: Holy guacomole!! I found Mexican food heaven! We were so excited tasting everything. The Salsa Bar is awesome! We loved everything.  Great service. We couldn't even finish because portions are huuge!

hWM5w237_X0rxEZ79dkoyQ.text: Great place! Awesome food, best salsa bar in town.  Clean environment and very friendly staff. We will definitely be back again. The breakfast menu is really good and pricing is reasonable.

p0NiBBPFhQ3c7B99jx650Q.text: Really disappointed in this place, the two stars were  only given because the restaurant and bathroom was clean and the only saving grace I would recommend is the "cochinita pibil" taco. Let me begin by saying we came in sat down restaurant was empty waitresses were talking amongst themselves for a good 8 minutes before we were greeted. Cool not a big problem they are only human. The menu had a terrible background which made it hard to see the selections and I kind of wished our waitress interacted with us and suggested some good eats. It was like a hi here's the menu Be back in 10 kind of service. I ordered the Hochata because of the good reviews husband ordered a sprite. The hochata had walnuts with strawberries, but the strawberries tasted very acidy which threw off the drink and the hochata was very watered down. The complimentary chips were cold,stale and burnt.  It was nice they had a salsa bar but they weren't anything special the cups were so tiny you had to go multiple times(not a deal breaker as I can see it as cost effective for them I suppose.) The restaurant was cute but very tiny. My husband's order was "meh" from what he said  he ate only  half. I ordered the three taco plate because I wanted to try the selection here's where it gets interesting: the "cochinita pibil" was pretty good if there's one stand out thing I can say in that menu it's that! Tasted as good as authentic. It was the only solace for me. The other taco I ordered was the "Al' pastor" guys this taco was so bland and dry and fatty not in a good way but when you bit into it it was literally chewy pieces of pork fat there was more fat then meat. The worst taco after this was the Mahi A'l pastor" it smelled really bad. I've had mahi before and it wasn't the regular smell it should smell like however I thought well I'm pregnant so I thought maybe it's just my hormones and smell sense. Well I decided to give it to my husband because it was giving me nausea and I thought nothing of it til we left and I asked him what he thought of it. Now mind you my husband is not picky and loves fish loves the outdoors eating deer wild things etc. but he said "I took one bite and almost threw up" it tasted like the smell of cow manure I couldn't swallow the first bite." So we both guessed late that it was spoiled. He didn't want to make a fuss and I thought it was just me. But nope we were right. The only thing that crosses my mind is as a cook as a server why would you think it would be alright to serve this to someone if it smelled awful? We paid 40 dollars for three tacos,beans rice and one burrito and two non alcoholic drinks. Which was pricy for the quality to be so disappointing. That was enough for me to say on to you guys that be very cautious in going here. I do not recommend it and we will not come here again unfortunately.

yrpLtcfANmT8fbZVUoyXQw.text: Visiting Phoenix and thought this might be a worthy try. Opened the front door and BAM a large party was seated exactly in front of the door. Awkward! I waited at the 'wait to be seated sign', right in front of the party of 15...took the host a bit longer than I like to wait... With all of the diners kinda staring at you. Iist not like they didn't have space in the restaurant. It's really a good size. But for some reason they thought it was smart to put a large party right in front of the entrance door. I ordered to go and it's taking a while for me to  get my meal. So much for to go. Not a great part of town, just a bit of blight. Safe, tho', just the environment of this part of town leaves a lot to be desired.

MZilA3NmOtCen0-n7junJQ.text: Waited a while to get our order taken 4 tables total of 9 people in various stages of dining.  Service was bad food was average and a little on expensive side.  Had high hopes... Will not return nor recommend.

uB3VnRawdna3mXN0ce9vVg.text: Found this restaurant on Yelp.  Visiting AZ for Spring Training.   You have got to try this place.   Absolutely delicious!  Great food, tons of choices and yummy house margaritas.  Loved the salsa bar.   I ordered the street tacos.  3 different flavors with beans and rice.  I had the tinga, el pastor and chicken.  Super delicious.  Rice and beans perfect with the tacos.   We had a couple of the house margaritas during happy hour and they were sweet but tart.  Food arrived quickly.   Wish I lived here so I could try everything on the menu.   Beautiful art on the walls and very friendly staff.

ozLxWounveXmkUEIvdXYtg.text: Holy hell, their Arab-style burrito (a tahini sauce, al pastor, etc., in a burrito) is the best burrito I've ever had. I got a few of the cochinita pibil tacos as well based on another yelper's comments, and those we indeed excellent, but the burrito for me was the real standout. The pairing of tahini and smoked pepper sauce is a total winner, and is very interesting given the history of middle eastern food in Mexico.   Also, don't skip the horchata. It has strawberries and nuts, and is devoid of the chalky horchata mix that many places had. Best horchata I've ever had - and like burritos - I've had my share.   My only complaint was the chocolate mole taco - it was far too sweet for my taste, and had too much mole on it and ended up being overpowering. However, if you love super chocolately moles, you'll probably like!

jCcIRwScVXu2bqpY9tX6gg.text: I've tried a handful of different plates. Everything I've tried so far is good. They have a great selection of salsas. Some have a kick some don't but they are all good. Besides the constant reggae playing in the background the atmosphere is good. One thing I will say and hope you take my advice on is ORDER El Gaucho Quesadilla. If you ordered anything else you gone screwed up. Leave, come back and order El Gaucho Quesadilla. As you consume the best thing on the menu you will instantly feel regret for ordering anything else as well as regret for never being able to order anything else on the menu. I wanted to give this place 4 stars but El Gaucho is well worth the 5th star alone.  (Update 3/21/16) They seemed to have ditched the reggae for Spanish Rock! I mean Jaguares/Caifanes etc.  Definitely a 5 star establishment.

XwEqIvcAfj2Sg_gVaQdA8Q.text: I would say taco shop is a misnomer. It is a small restaurant/ bar. Very interesting food, not typical "Taco shop" fare by any means.  Ive been there a few times now, their quesadillas are more like calzones, very tasty! Portion size is good.Their chocolate cake is a must order.  They have a strange salsa bar, a lot of "novelty" salsa. Interesting for sure.  The paper and plastic baskets instaed of plates is one thing, but, too nice inside for use of the cheapest plastic flatware ever made, (not even the decent ones) Please buy bulk stainless @ Costco. That plastic is useless, hard to eat with.  I would recommend this place for sure.

lUWghIMmGf63_iSVZ0KW_g.text: Food was good as always but it took an hour to get. It was kinda busy but they have no flow. If any of the owners/ managers are reading this..contact me if you need another server/ manager to help sort out this mess. Im a closer at a restaurant right now and would be willing to help you guys out. This happens every time we are there. It's painful to watch, your servers are running around like chickens with their heads cut off whenever more than 5 tables are there.

hvp78IzPoO1GCQ2PNmcJNg.text: The food is EXCELLENT! The salsa bar is outrageous. Hands down best mexican food we've had.

u-kpraaPy_lGzIUbh7_pKg.text: Ya'll know I'm going to plant a solid 5 STARs for the gourmet-all-you-can-eat SALSAs in this wonderful establishment!   Incredibly pleasing choices ranging from mild n' smokey to furious, flame-grilled. Warm chips are served and the menu is brimming with delectable, hot choices including burros, quesas, and super-tasty fillers.   Firstly, the pecan-fruit filled horchata is like a cold, lingering dessert. And it's huge, perhaps +32ounces of deliciousness. Spoon, please!  The Mole Chicken burrito was on the *sweeter* side and although super complex and dark choco-infused, it called for 3xpinch more spice to counter the sucrose.  The beans and rice are fair to fairly good, but nothing special. I've had great refried beans in my life and La Santisima could improve on this. I'll admit.   The melted queso dip pleased the eye but must be consumed ASAP, prior to cooling down. Order prior to entree.  The la House burro was very savory, filled with shredded, grilled chicken and finely chopped fixings.  Service was genuine and sweet. Hoping to have a party their soon!   A clean, cozy, artful gourmet taco shop is what you can expect from La Santisima.    Next visit:  margaritas and tacos .

kqa3c86iG-Uceauv2lNBsg.text: My family decided once a month we will try a new place. We came across this restaurant that was right down the road from us. They have the best horchata in town!!! Their Azteca soup was so delicious and their portions were enormous. The service was perfect. Attended to all of our needs while also letting us enjoy our meal. We will definitely be coming back.

This place is a great little shop in downtown Glendale.   If you are feeling adventurous try the Chile En Nogada Taco... it will blow your mind!

KcJiABleefdeg2l8jPTzqw.text: Tacos al Pastor   they are delicious !! We have tried the other tacos also but always keep coming back to the Al Pastor   the mole tacos are also awesome

3QyL1csUXXpPuV0CACmXUw.text: I was looking forward to some good tacos. Service was good Tried all the many different hot sauces. K4hPsrKxUozKd8QxsSbwDQ.text: Imagine if you will waking up in Arizona sweltering summer heat. It's 65 inside and 120 outside. Saturday at 11:00 a.m., you scratch your head and rollover. "Where's the day gone?" Muttering it's bright out and why can't someone turn that damn sun off. A flood of hunger squeezes your brain. This, followed by an inner scream, "Feed me!" Limbic regions and cerebral cortex throb pushing your temples outward. It's like an alien; this hangover you're nursing from too much red wine Friday night. In a graceful half-stumble, half-pike and slide your now out of bed opening the slider and letting out fiddo. "Damn, I have errands;" washing down two Tylenol with half a flat Pepsi. Now, where, do I eat!  Let me help out a friend. Go to LA SANTISMA and order the following:  1. A ginormous margarita (double strength = hair of the dog); 2. Order the guacamole and chips (don't be scared off by cranberries and mango - they make the guac AMAZING); 3. Order the Baja Sur Dogfish Shark Taco; 4. Order the Oaxaca Black Mole Chicken Shark Taco; 5. Order the El Gaucho Steak taco; and 6. Inhale as much fresh salsa from the incredible salsa bar.  You can thank me later...it's later.

F9iqpkhmSNYYR-Xn9HWUKA.text: After getting off our flight to Phoenix, we decided we needed margaritas STAT. We browsed online and found this place, though it wasn't supposed to open for another 45 minutes at the time. So we did the obvious thing and drove there and waited in the parking lot until it opened. Totally worth it. The decoration in the restaurant is Day of the Dead I believe and it is amazing. The server was 1 girl who took care of everyone and even made all the bar drinks. She killed it though and was super friendly. I got the Blue Demon Margarita and drank it before I thought to take a picture but it had little blueberries in it and oh god it was the most refreshing drink I've ever had. Never thought I'd say that about a margarita but it was delicious.  My meal was a Burro with red enchilada sauce on it. Normally green sauce is hot for me and red isn't but boy this red had some kick to it. Then again I'm a wuss when it comes to any kind of hot so eh. Was still delicious though. Everyone else really enjoyed their food and drinks. The only thing was that portions were huge so we probably should have shared everything hah.  Great first meal after a hectic flight to Phoenix.

oagHaixC1_q4KD1r0VC3hA.text: I was somewhat lost with the menu but decided on the Al pastor quesadilla. My waiter, Juan said it was the most popular and good. It arrived about 25 minutes later which seemed like a long time given there was only one other customer in the restaurant. Jaun did not lie, it was worth the wait. I will be back soon. Great food.

zvI-IP5AH0n8IGV7Mm0mXg.text: So this place has its pros and cons. Starting with the parking in the back, it can get tricky to get to, especially if it is your first time here. The customer service was great, we were greeted and they brought our drinks and chips in a timely manner. They have agua de horchata, which is made with strawberry and other fruits that are "secret ingredients", however overall it is delicious (it may not be for everyone though!). The food itself though is where it went down hill. Don't get me wrong this picture may look good, but the taste was lacking. The meat and shrimp lacked flavor, although they use spices the taste was very plain and I was not satisfied, I was full just not content. The only thing that was good were the rice and beans. Other than that, I would not recommend coming to this place for tacos.

ItgJM9VnSwzFaY6RZjQp0g.text: La Santisima might be a lot of things to a lot of people, but to me, they will always be the restaurant that set the "gold standard" for horchata in Phoenix. Seriously, order one, and you'll quickly realize that no one else does it quite as good as they do here.   The original La Santisima, over on 16th Street, has always had a reputation for great Mexican food, which is why most people are willing to forgive their notoriously slow service and long wait times.  This location eliminates a lot of the service and wait time issues. Sure, the setup might not be quite as charming, but the food is largely consistent with what you'd find at the original location. It's nice to be able to swing by here for a horchata and some tacos, without having to make a big "event" out of the whole thing.  Santisima's guacamole is quite memorable, being filled with so many fruity chunks that it straddles the fine line between a dip/spread and a fruit dish. Additionally, their street tacos, including one of the better pastor options you'll find, are all very well done. Perfect? No. But consistently good.  Santisima's menu has always kind of intimidated me, because there's just so much stuff that's worth trying. My girlfriend and I are usually a bit afraid to deviate from favorites, but the few times we have done so, such as the time we tried their quesadilla, tells me that there's a lot of great things to be found on their menu.  Out of all your options in Downtown Glendale, this is definitely one of your better ones.  Recommended!

DgxxI6DzCVHXIxuogpopTw.text: First time, NOT MY LAST TIME!  Very very good Mexican food here FYI! A more traditional type of restaurant with authenticity from the moment you walk in. The menu alone will make you question what you really know about Mexican food. We ordered the Sonora Arrachera Lonche(torta), the El Gaucho Burrito, and Tacos; Tinga, carne, and pollo asado. Rice and beans on the side. Beans were homemade no question about. Not typical, every item we ordered was flavorful, fulfilling, and left us wanting more!   We were most surprised by the Horchata, family recipe with strawberry, melon, cinnamon and pecans! Guarantee you've never seen anything like this. The taste is amazing and a must try!

I ordered horchata to drink and it was soooo good. It's served with fruit and pecans in the drink which I've never had but it was very tasty. kTEvj-_djCSro9IE1Tpfuw.text: I went here for the first time last summer and I loved it. GREAT salsa, good food, and good drinks.   My mom plays in the summer band in downtown Glendale so that's the only time we make it out to that area. We decided to go back again this year before one of her concerts. I was pretty disappointed this time.   When we walked in we noticed a weird, burnt smell, like burnt meat. It was a little off-putting but not enough to leave. The place was empty but service was still slow. One girl working the bar and serving.   We ordered margaritas and when they came they were almost clear. We thought maybe it was going to be all tequila or something, but when we tried it, it tasted like salt water. We asked for more triple sec thinking that would help. It didn't really. I've never had such a weird tasting margarita before.   The salsa bar was still amazing, but the food was pretty average this time. I'll probably go back next year (if it's still there) to try it one last time.

VuXnCw0GnB5M7XuZvz8rvA.text: Love this place!! Especially when they have a couple of vegan options!!  They stuff their tacos - and are delicious! They're small but 3 does me in.... Plus with the chips & the 15 different salsas is enough for me...   m-m-m-m good!

l_0C0Rz7k46_cHyguloc-g.text: I've eaten at this restaurant numerous times over the course of a few years and figured it's finally time I leave a review.  Let me start off by saying that there are a LOT, and I mean a LOT of Mexican restaurants in Phoenix; but La Santisima is by far my personal favorite. While many places are good, most Mexican restaurants don't really stand out as they are very slight variations of others in the area.   Their salsas are awesome! And the selection seems to be ever-changing. There are almost always new varieties when I dine in.  While their menu isn't as (comparatively) large as competitors each dish is, their dishes are authentic, distinctive and DELICIOUS. Their horchata is even made in a way that you won't find at most restaurants, and it's fantastic (refreshing,compared to the beverage typically served from a concentrate).  If y'all haven't already given this restaurant a try, I recommend it!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Horchata. SUPER TASTY!
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. La Santisima Specialty Taco with steak, Oaxacan black mole taco, Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco

zWl5fHwxiWstjAU2Zto98Q.text: This is one of my favorite Mexican restaurants in Phoenix metro.    I ate at this location (never been to the 16th St one) many times because it is close to my square dance club at 59th Ave and Dunlap. I discovered it thru Check Please.  I highly recommend the Marlin Quesidilla, about $15. Sooooo good, crispy outside, like a huge empanada. I can make 3 meals out of it, as some of the salsa bar items can be a meal in itself. Marlin tacos are great too.   I suggest you bring your own little salsa bowls to bring to the salsa bar, because they only provide little plastic sauce take-out things that are so small and shallow, you cannot dip anything in them, and you have to go back to the salsa bar get more again and again.  There is something in the salsa bar that looks like pickled sliced green tomatoes with onions that is really delicious.  Fruit horchata is delicious too.  I suggest you have them put the ice in separate cup, or your drink will be all watered down.

UP1Fuz2FQXMnSHNT5WGczw.text: Excellent salsa bar. There were 14-18 salsas to try. Our favorites were peanut, tomatillo, peppers and onions, roasted red pepper, cilantro.   I enjoyed the La Santisima Burro with mahi mahi. The salsas were an excellent accompaniment to the burro.   We will be back soon.

BgAKnp57rJ9ZOlOKr2ddNg.text: The food was very good.  I don't like the paper they use on the wicker baskets they use for plates, because the food is soo juicy it soaks through the paper and attaches to my food.  Also, because the baskets have paper covers on top there is no way to use as vessels for their amazing salsa bar, so you have to use the tiniest little plastic cups to try out the salsas and make about 10 trips to get enough of every kind you'd like.  I would have given this place 5 stars but I do not like paper bits on my food.

J29ZtFBzqgwXXY5kCHKQpw.text: Somewhat of a rip-off! Another one of those Mexican places for White people that do not know better. I can honestly say I have never had a spicy flavorless burrito, now I can. First we were given a can of soda and charged $3 for it. 2017 let's get a fountain system you cheap bastards. We tried the tacos and I was really excited after reading the other reviews and wah wah, flat and not filling. After we left we went to another taco place because we were craving good tacos. I love to spend money on good food and this was not it. The quality of the food does not match the high prices. If you are a foodie you are better off at a taco truck, any taco truck.

bN73lkp4J3vnPdjhMBPfew.text: We have been here on three occasions so far, and I really like the food. The quesa poblano (Quesadilla with poblano chili's and oaxaca cheeese) is awesome.  I have only had the carne asada and al pastor street tacos, with beans and rice, and have no complaints.  Perhaps my favorite thing is the salsa bar, I am really partial to the Seven Chili's and the Salsa Mexicana, but there are so many great choices.  My only complaint is that on 2 of the three occasions we have been there, they have been understaffed on the front end.  Food comes out quickly, but not always the best service.  We never had our water refilled, and it took three requests to get a beer brought to the table.  Can't blame the server, they have been busy, but management may want to reconsider how they staff.   Overall, this is becoming on of my favorite go-to spots for tacos.  If the service improves, I would bump it up to 5 stars.

xjc2FKcbRkR--vMl3oTadQ.text: You are better than this Santasima. We have been loving your food for over 3 years but your service the last several times has been to the point of embarrassing.  We understand that servers and cooks come and go but if all you can do is offer excuses then don't offer anything. Just stay quiet and try to bring the delicious food you serve as best you can. 1 hour on a Tuesday night just to get chips and order a drink? 3 tries to get an order of mole tacos correct? Order a mojito and get a margarita? Anyone that has spent time in and around the service industry understands that some nights are tougher than others. This now makes 4 tries in a row where your service and professionalism were quite frankly....disgusting.  We love your food but until you can somehow prove that your attitude towards service and quality relationships has changed we will not be back. Very disappointing.

2DkoVn4UdU4jysx6nhVT0g.text: I have to say I'm very pleased and impressed with this spot .. I was raised and born in California and just moved to Arizona .. This place reminds me of my parents come cooked food and what I love more was that they serve the food in the clay plates ! Platos de baro are the best !

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States

oMCnd3x2M1jnbUPN8fQA6A.text: We stopped in for the first time based on a recommendation of another Yelper.  The chairs are extremely comfortable, but the artwork on the wall is very strange. I don't get it. It seems like they just decided to hang ugly paintings instead of actually painting the walls, they are very dirty.   Our service was ok, but I assume she was new. I ordered 2 tacos a la carte and my boyfriend ordered a meal which comes with beans and rice. We then headed up to the salsa bar to accompany our chips. There were sooo many to choose from. I loved the green salsa and who would have known salsa made from radishes would actually be really tasty??  Our tacos were great, the beans didn't taste like they were from a can and the meat was cooked perfectly. The only issue I had with my lunch were the taco shells, I feel like they were a little too soggy.

3gwygoIpFMRgEEfvN29FeQ.text: I've been here a couple of times now for lunch.  I had been to the other location previously known as La Condesa once so I knew the food was going to be good.  And it certainly is.  Parking seems like it could be a hassle at times.  Another Yelper says they park at the school when it is not in session.  This time I noticed the back gate was open with an empty lot on the other side of the alley but my server could not tell me if it was ok to park there.  The salsa bar is always a delight and I try to limit myself to two per meal so I can keep track of what I am having.  Service both times has been OK but sort of an afterthought.  I will certainly keep this place in the lunch rotation.
