TybDU6cNYDQfVGGFfowPRA.text: This place would be five stars, but the service is slow.  If you see a nearly empty restaurant, do not assume that things will be speedier.  The servers are friendly and you will be seated promptly, but beyond that  expect a bit of a wait.   Atmosphere is not the best, its actually a bit dull.  But I do like the decor, which is dia de muerta and graffiti type canvases on the wall, and beautiful solid wood doors that I wish I had at home.  So why four stars?  The food is good!  I have had the Sonoran Carne Asada Taco, Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco, Cabo Shrimp Taco, and the Sonora Arrachera Quesa.  They were all very good, but my favorite was the Sonora Arrachera Quesa.  Very fattening, but well worth all the calories.  They have a salsa bar with a diverse array of choices, and I do enjoy the all the exotic options.  Oh and the Horchata is decent.  Unfortunately, I believe they will not last too long.  It is always empty, and they are closing earlier every time I visit.  Maybe location is not the greatest, and the service is sluggish, but I really hope they stick around.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Arracha steak Quesa

f8ODKZ4tsBq_8D6Se80dFg.text: Fiance and I went on a week night to come out this restaurant for wedding rehearsal dinner.  We were seated and given chips.  Was a relatively busy night. Only one waiter appeared to be working. Lady from behind the bar came and gave us water after 10 minutes.  Waited almost 20 minutes before walking out without ever having our order taken. Two other couples came in and their orders were taken right away. Very poor service for a nice looking place.

xQKFu2NmgXgSLR78HKHN6w.text: Looooove their salsa bar. The food is good too and the prices are reasonable for sure. The service wasn't the best though. It might have just been that day, but I had to get up 3x to ask for things because the waitress didn't return.

ehkgSztg-O2wadWX7CTNRA.text: I have nothing bad to say about La Santisima! One of my favorite restaurants for sure! Sure it gets busy but the waitresses that work there are ALWAYS sweet and positive. The food never disappoints me. I always order the Jamaica or Horchata and the street tacos with the beans and rice.

9gg3HZYfr2BvWl88-tyi5g.text: Really good tacos!!! Love the multiple choices of salsa!!!!  The protein style taco was crazy!!!!!

hWKy5EIR6YCr1iM8j-O0SQ.text: My wife found this place based on reviews while she was traveling earlier this month. It just so happened that we were already coming back to this area for vacation, and this was the first place we ate at in Glendale because she previously had such a good meal.  So my expectations were very high because it's all she has been talking about.  And I was not disappointed! First of all, the salsa bar is huge and offers so many diverse flavors. Pecan? Peanut? Radish? Along with the more traditional salsas. Here's a tip, try mixing the Pecan with the Rabano Pibil (Radish) for a great combination. My personal favorite was the guacamole salsa, it definitely has some heat.  I had the El Goucho Quesa and it was amazing. It's like a deepfried quesadilla, with amazing argentine seak with tons of other goodness inside. The Oaxaca cheese is so good sprinkled across the top along with avocado slices.  Another thing that beat my expectations - the house margarita. A little sweeter than the usual margarita (flavor comes from grapefruit juice) and if I weren't driving I would have had 2 during the meal.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Found this sweet artwork in the parking lot.
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. So many amazing salsas to choose from. Also shown is the house margarita - highly recommended!

AaWJ9oVv5H5PJLGCgz-NQQ.text: I can come back to this place anytime! I always recommend this Mexican Gourmet restaurant to all my friends when they are up to trying something new.  I love ordering the street tacos with rice and beans. The Cochinito Pibil meat is very delicious. The horchata is mouth watering! The horchata is served with pineapples, strawberries, and peanuts at the top of the drink.  It's a great place for a date, lunch, or after work happy hour. I wouldn't recommend big parties.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Street Tacos with Rice and Beans. Horchata with strawberries, pineapples and peanuts.

pDmHY1FNVHVdAX5p-aCxHQ.text: My rating is based on experiences from previous visits to the sister establishment on 16th St.  The service and quality do not hold up here.  I hate to be so blunt but that is the way it has to be.  I have watched people walk out due to lack of service.  Watched a father and son dine without silverware!  THEY DID IT.  Will they be back???  Watched my uncle clean a dirty table that had been sitting dirty long before we had decided to sit outside and just before we had decided to leave.  All in the same day.  The food has been really good here, but they definitely have some growing to do.  We have come to love La Santisima's and would have no problem going back to the 16th St. location.  Get it together.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. In progress mural in the parking lot.  Should be cool when its finished!
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Smoked Marlin and Aztec Tinga tacos.  Both excellent.
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. The Mayan Quesa.

URX9keWO8mFXa-mIthfDVw.text: My favorite is the Al Pastor Quesa. A bit spicy and I don't normally do spicy but for this, I'll suck it up! Their yummy Horchata with fruits in it,  cools it all down for me  Great food!

BbOsNNw7FEybIJaO2OUJvA.text: Unbelievable food, service was lacking but worth the crappy service to get the food.  They need more staff.

t1unbgVqTeAncIgnY_bhMw.text: Delicious tacos, lots of variety to choose from! They also have a salsa bar with a ton of different salsas to pick from. We got a glass of Sangria and it was huge but delicious. It's a small hole in the wall type place, kinda sketchy area. Parking available in the back. Would def recommend this place to anyone. Will be back for sure!!!

A0TD2dDKx_O7qrUsZykBOw.text: Small little restaurant w/ parking in the back. Great food, cabo shrimp tacos are amazing and they have one of the most unique salsa bars for any mexican restaurant i have been to. About 15 different varieties of salsa to try. Will definitely be back to try more of the menu.

1eDfReY89YekacD8MiNqBQ.text: The food is great, the local area is a little on the sketchier side but the salsa bar makes it worth it.  Get the tacos: steak and fish are the best  Ppl do park in the dirt lot next to it if they run out of space. There's also an asian market you can park at and walk if need be.

BOLJc6wKDe0PZO31QFTEUg.text: My favorite place in the entire world. Amazing salsa bar, fruity margaritas and a very friendly staff. Always great service. Tell ya friends and fam, La Santisima is the best.

AnZt5zkRXSkmART2G4GHmQ.text: All I can say is that sht was pretty dang good! And the Salsa bar is amazing! There is actual spicy salsa options here. Pastor burrito and Guacho tacos were delicious.

idfxoDH0rtAUjHDR0quEiA.text: It was ok. Server was not very keen on anticipating customer needs. I had never been there, and wasn't familiar w the menu or anything. Maybe because I'm Mexican, I wasn't falling over myself about the salsa bar  Horchata was good, although I'd recommend asking for light ice since its 4$ for a 32oz cup, and they throw in nuts and fruit in it also. Finally got  a quesadilla. I basically paid 24 bucks including tip for a soft drink, Horchata, rice and quesadilla. All of which weren't outstanding, service wasn't and since this is my hood, I know that the surroundings aren't worth the price tag either. Recommend you NOT go here and seriously if a salsa bar is where u get ur rocks. Then u obviously don't mind paying for it w the normal tasting food, that is waaaayyy overpriced.

hLDgxDK9Js6uUuFYd9ghGw.text: Definitely the best mexican place in the west valley! Very authentic and unique flavors! Escape all the chains and go to this place! You can't go wrong with the margarita that has grapefruit in it!

trBvbswYbdZESAE8P8ptkA.text: Haven't been to this location yet and decided to try it out since the original place my boyfriend was trying to take me was closed. Still delicious! Staff was light and there wasn't very many people there but it took awhile for the food to come out.

IvLt25lDRTWbLLUVuMAtRg.text: I've always passed by the place but didn't take notice until I got a groupon for it and wanted to try it out. I really liked the decor and the restaurant looks clean. The food I ordered was great and fresh, and the horchata was quite different from other places but it was pretty good. They had a wide variety of salsa, my favorite was the salsa pecan. I would most likely come back again for the food and good customer service.

CgoknG7U75UrrA5f2xjc9Q.text: This is a hidden gem, nestled anongst fifty more taco shops it really stands out. Their menu features dogfish shark a fliet mignon tacos that really live up to the name gourmet. The salsa bar is features approximately 20 different salsas that range from peanut to classic pico. They are however lacking in the service department as well as quality beverage choices.

hCW2uZ4Cu8TGHSCT7Hmebw.text: Visiting Phoenix for the first time and we tried this place for lunch - from the outside we weren't so sure about heading in but boy are we glad we did!!   The decor inside is very cool - when we sat down they brought out fresh tortilla chips and we went up to their salsa bar and tried our way through at least 6 salsas leaving many more we didn't even get to try!  My hubby got 4 different tacos to try and couldn't pick a fave he liked them all so much!  I got the veggie quesa, a twist on quesadilla made with a crispy corn shell - it was delicious yet huge I couldn't even get through half!    I'd highly recommend checking this place out!

yBckTAokdAOSDsbkVc2QXw.text: Great food and service, which is key. Horchata is off the hook!!!!!!! Plus it's been on DDD's. Worth yo time!

yDYuw_9mV_sjqOgEPpDnjQ.text: HORRIBLE service!!!! They have good food, but the service is so awful that it's truly not worth your time.  The staff is unprepared and rude. Sat for a while without being even noticed and once we were served they never came back. Horrible service! Other people around us got their food to go due to the service and the staff was ignoring other tables as well! Numerous customers were upset. Go to their other location, it's much more friendly and the staff is on top of things.

NdYCgzhpvRfkLGP-GN8pVA.text: This place is the real deal! Lots of "gourmet taco" restaurants around these days and they're for the most part good. But this place seems more like a gourmet taco place you would find in Mexico. Real  authentic ingredients put together in different ways. I had the shredded pork tacos. The pork was so tender and flavorful, they didn't even need salsa added to them. speaking of salsa, this place features a salsa bar with around a dozen different salsa varieties: jicama salsa, peanut salsa, radish salsa, just to name a few of the crazy ones. To top it off, there's some pretty amazing artwork on the walls. Even the bathroom doors are beautiful. This place is a must try! I'll definitely be back

Z3vILWFY_u2ojFebp1iBnw.text: My friend and I decided to come here for cinco de mayo thinking it was going to be good. It wasn't. Horrible service who failed to tell us they were out of pastor and horchata. Came to our table once. And our server didn't know what kind of margaritas they served. The tortillas seemed like they were microwaved and the tacos were mediocre. Don't recommend it.

lwsD_I-vjtndReVZCRSDAg.text: This place has jumped to number one on my Phoenix taco list.  For real, OMG, we got a Groupon and decided to redeem it today.  The salsa bar... it's freaking amazing (strawberry, chipotle/pecan, cilantro crema, and many others).  Don't even get me started on the horchata.  I had NOTHING bad, or even average here, it was all amazing.  Cute, trendy/rustic decor, and the food is outstanding.  The mole was so smokey and rich and flavorful and the Mayan cochinita pibil taco was so tangy and tender.  Seriously, I ate until I literally could eat no more.  America's used to be my go-to for cheap tacos a la carte, but this place has edged firmly into first place.

OZ4DOo05Mre373R1Uq85zg.text: Food was good, nothing to write home about. They have a ton of different salsas at their salsa bar, only about 3 are tasty & worth eating. However, their house margaritas are amazing. Staff is friendly. Only real complaint was their A/C was not cold enough which made it uncomfortably warm in the restaurant, especially when the temperature outside is 110+.

2kR25af5IQuIdQX233yUDA.text: Service here is absolutely awful! Expect to sit and wait 20 to 30 minutes just to order your drink. Today we waited for 30 minutes to be greeted only to be told that their register was down and they were no longer taking orders for the day. Had they told us that when we arrived, that would have made things much easier. Will not return again

JHKHi4caswPcviOFW-eeJg.text: One of the best burritos I have ever had! I ordered the Santisima burrito with shrimp and after waiting impatiently for it to cool down enough to eat it, I was amazed at the complex flavor explosion...I had a cute waitress who was made sure I had everything and checked back often. The salsa bar is THE BEST I have ever encountered, I tried 4, which was about 1/4 of them, and was blown away by the Pecan Salsa, WOW....I wanted to try a marg but went with a beer, gives me a reason to come back....Very cool interior and a decent variety of beers and Tequilas...

P9vDOzFwdFG0M5ayCWUakQ.text: Decided to take my dad on a lunch date to La Santisima. We were both more than impressed with the taste and presentation of the food. I purchased a two taco plate and was stuffed like a turkey on Thanksgiving, well worth it! The salsa bar was amazing, so many options, you can't try them all in one sitting. This definitely means I'm going back for more!

j8aqdy6GhFKs9IAHrO6aWA.text: Absolutely the best Mexican food that I have had outside of Monterrey, MX! We were waited on by the owner and we had 5 star service. We will be back as soon as possible.

7YFlPySzNFkupyywUW-hPA.text: This is for the new Glendale location- we've never been to the one across town. I'm definitely a fan of this place, and we'll be back for sure. This place fills the niche for good Mexcian food that isn't heavy and greasy. It was empty when we walked in but there was a steady trickle of people in and out. The waiter was extremely friendly. He explained portions of the menu to us, chatted a bit, and the service was prompt and polite.  The salsa bar wasn't all that I'd hoped for but it was interesting. Lots of different salsas but many of them were spicy and I didn't really love any of them. Hubby did though so that might just have been my issue. The food, on the other hand, was delicious. Hubby had mole and it tasted like mole is supposed to taste. Like chili and chocolate and all sorts of yumminiess rolled together. I had an Arabic burrito which was much more delicious than it sounds. They happily made it without onions for me and it was awesome.  Oh, and order the horchata. Trust me. They make it in house and if horchata tasted like this all the time I'd drink it way more often. Parking is in the back and there is a surprising amount of space considering they're on the edge of downtown Glendale. I also appreciate that the parking area is VERY well lit.

cEK2zwQaLQWkLhYZcVff1g.text: I had the chicken tinga and dogfish shark tacos. The tinga was packed with flavor. My companion had the chicken mole taco, and I have to say that's what I'll get next time. It was the perfect combination of heat and sweet. Victoria beer rounded everything off. Service was adequate. If you're looking for Mexican food off the beaten path, try La Santisima.

RxQMdmeTE_zl4odgFSOVoQ.text: Have been here several times as it's within walking distance to my home.  Service and food has always been good.  Some evenings it gets pretty packed and things slow down, but, it's not fast food, so take your time and relax.  This is definitely one of the better quality Mexican places in the valley and it's nice to not have food completely covered in oil and salt, which is what many of the Mexican places think Americans want. It good tasty fair where you can actually taste the ingredients.

j92VXNXMR0r_Q0u6spj52w.text: Love coming here! Their food is always fresh and I love snacking on their chips and salsa while we wait for our food.

vJsIjHm4jhFIkswBS8UwhA.text: Hands down best horchata I've had. Great variety of salsas to choose from. Good food!  4 stars because the tortillas weren't as good as other places.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Tacos (pollo asada, mole, al pastor), rice, and beans
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Salsa mexicana
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Some of the salsas offered

VFKwaAFS0kfdmn1p4rSmoA.text: This place is AMAZING!!!! The food, service, salsa bar and atmosphere are all excellent. The Conchitna Pibil tacos are the best thing ever. My family loves the Mole! I have also had the Mahi Mahi tacos, they are great too. I have not been to the original location but nothing about this location sells you short.   The strawberry salsa is surprisingly great. I fact, all of the salsas were. There is so many its unreal! I had a house margarita, it was great too. I have nothing but great things to say about this awesome establishment. I have now been back 3 times since my first visit and have not been let down.  PS....the beans and rice are authentic and extremely great too :)

Rwu6lZXIb34hvkrJkWi8rg.text: Amazing tacos!!! The salsa bar is like nothing I've had at any other taco place. There were so many to choose from and each got better. The portions are huge and the staff is awesome!

Bn7UzzrCycV4UqccvlQ4Ow.text: Checked out this place about a week ago because I wanted to try some new Mexican food. I was pleasantly surprised with how good everything was. The guacamole with mango, cranberries and jicama seemed odd but I was intrigued. Ended up being the best guacamole I have ever had.  The beer battered shrimp and baby shark tacos were delicious. So good. And last but not least, the quesadilla was amazing. Very similar to an empanada in that they took raw tortilla, stuffed it, then deep fried it. Blew my mind. So good. I might order from them again tonight. It's a little bit of a ride from where I live (25 minutes) but definitely worth it.

Rv100B_YmXkXtmkLBRl0Rg.text: Two words : The Best!  As I am new to the valley, o have been exploring places to eat. Came across this place and I'll be sure to turn into a regular. The food was different than I'm  used to ( authentic mexican ).  But oh my..... so delish!  I ordered a shark taco and the Guacho burro.  The salsas were all superb! The horchata was good,  I think I'd still like to see the original horchata on the menu though.    Overall, fantastic place, and Stacy the server was on point!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Fish taco and I don&#39;t remember the other. Boss&#39;lunch.
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Guacho burro and shark taco.  Even the zucchini was good!!
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Horchata and Tortilla chips and Mexican salsa (left). I like the pecan salsa and jicama one as well.

2ytMzodZY89ippNmlUqKOQ.text: Almost as good as the original (OK, not sure if this is the original location or Phoenix is but 16th street is original for me). I'm not sure what it is about that location... The food is a tad better, in my opinion, but this location is much closer when I'm at my office.   Food: I usually get the el pastor burrito... It's delicious. All the tacos are good and I haven't had any complaints on anything from the numerous people I've brought here. I always fill up on chips and salsa because there are SO MANY - my favorites are the cilantro and chipotle salsas and guacamole; tip: mix the chipotle salsa with a spicy one for a kick because it's not at all spicy!   Service: usually good. The credit card machine was out once... Not a huge issue for us or anyone I saw walk in but would have been disappointed if we didn't have cash.  My only complaint is that they serve the food in baskets and I would prefer plates (I think this is new... I can't remember) but I can work around that if I must... And I haven't asked for a plate, which I could also do

9nKUf8q3Wi4i3ky7xnYDmg.text: OH K, Tues at Santisima with 5 friends,just FAB,food,friends,conversation & a wait person that knows the menue (Jose). Pete had fish taco plate, Agnes had 3 taco plate, the same for her daughter,Donna,Dave & Elaine a soft taco each, they all had the Margaritas,my GO TO plate is el pastor burro, followed by coconut flan! SUPERIOR! On my way to la santisima on 16st & Oak for lunch wed.10/11 who wants to join? Twice to Glendale now, can't wait for lunch on 16 st  Sharlene

vfcLHMf2xgLqg7ful7o81Q.text: Was very disappointed with our last visit here. Now I can be very honest, they had two large parties but was not jam packed. I was in the restroom at the time of the drink order and my family did not order me anything. When the waitress came, she took my order but never came back with anything. I waited around 20 minutes for someone to come back and I once again placed my order.  From the time we sat down we knew it would be busy but never expected we would have to wait over am hour for our food to come. Not once did a waitress offer to refill our drinks and when someone did come by to offer more chips, they were given to the wrong table. Okay, we understand that stuff happens and large parties can throw people off but once the food came, we asked for 2 small plates as we were sharing with kids. Once again, the waitress never came back and the kids ended up sharing our plates and eating off of napkins. A more seasoned waitress came, and we expressed our frustration, the most she could offer was an apology and to discount our drinks.  My husband and I made an observation and the waitress who would leave a table after taking an order would go and clean tables instead of bringing what we asked for. It was a very disappointing experience.

KsK_kHRr_q6ylhu5nzHy-w.text: This is hard to write because every other time I have been here I have been very impressed.  Unfortunately it only takes one bad visit to ruin it for me entirely.    The menu finally changed, I am not sure at what point but everything on the menu has gone up in price.  I ordered a quesa which I was used to at a cheaper price.  I get it, things get more expensive as time goes on to a degree.  The service was astoundingly poor and this one hurt us the most.  The waitress barely paid any attention to us and we were the only ones who were inside eating.  There was a large group of employees who were all conversing and we were definitely left on the back burner when it came to attention.  I asked for silverware and she just pointed to the plastic knives and forks over by the salsa bar.  Five minutes later I witnessed the waitress placing the rolled silverware on all of the tables...except ours.  We also were never given a water refill or even checked up on.  We sat for about 10 minutes waiting for our check until I finally lost my patience and had to ask for it along with a to go container.  The last element that I really did not enjoy is the fact that the food is served on straw trays with a cheap wax paper on top.  When you are paying $14 for a menu item and eating with plastic knives and forks on a thin piece of paper...it just does not feel right.  It's too cheap for what you pay for.    Overall the food really is very good but has become much more expensive and when you are eating with a plastic knife and fork on a bogus plate along with a staff who could care less, I just can't justify giving my business there anymore which really is unfortunate.  This is a hard one to let go!  But the good news is that there are plenty of other spots around here in Phoenix that want your business and will appreciate it so go forth and discover them !

JdqI2vw_gkAwDxPzMG1owQ.text: It's good and all if you're into the new infused Mexican style food, my mom ordered the tacos en chile enogada and it was a little too sweet for her, my quesa de cochinita pivil was flavorful so that was a plus. I guess it depends on what you order it's a hot or miss. The service was not all that great, the tables were messy. Not worth the money, a salsitas or Federico's would be better.   Save your money

rJFzppwjRtObVqVlri6fIw.text: I brought my Mom to eat here since I heard their Quesadillas were the best and different. To my surprise the food is made where I'm from, Guadalajara. We had a great experience. The Male server attended us the whole time. Sometimes when it's good server they tend to overdo it a bit but not him. He was perfect amount of attention and courtesy. Quesadilla was a bit crispy more than I like it but my experience overall was the best. I definitely will be back with more customers! Thank you Santisima Team!

67YryhcmJ2Tp-fnAPEhQiA.text: First time at this restaurant, love all the vegetarian options. The downside is the small parking lot.  The cauliflower al pastor taco is amazing.

nbUvHHqyK07kSN2Rz6a0mw.text: Service was poor and it was empty too, around 8:30 pm. I ordered my grandson a bean and cheese burrito. He complained that the burrito was spicy and I thought he was just complaining. Come to find out, it had chili pods in it. We pulled out a couple of pods and the server replied, "They are added for taste." If we wanted a spicy bean and cheese burrito for him I would of added salsa from the salsa bar. The food wasn't all that and we NEVER got offered a refill on our drinks. I will never return to this place as I come back every year to see the Dodgers during their spring training. Save your money and go to a fast food restaurant. You are much better off not to mention their prices...

gwx7kWeREs9_yS8FsTdj7Q.text: We came by for a late lunch, around 3-is and were served immediately-there were maybe 3 or 4 other tables seated.   We ordered a horchata to drink, and it was one of the best I've ever had-with fruit and nuts added in.   They have a salsa bar with a multitude of labeled salsas you can try, our favorites were the peanut salsa (creamy with a hint of spice), the tomatillo and the chipotle.   We got three tacos and a enchilada style pork burrito. The pork was so tender it was falling apart

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Horchata with fruit and nuts, the best horchata I&#39;ve ever had
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Enchilada style burrito, the meat was super tender and delicious
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Three tacos, beans and rice. The carne asada taco was AMAZING. The meat for all three tacos=absolutely delicious

h7c9BaQrmBRhWCrRjfMwow.text: The food was incredible. The salsa bar is very impressive.  The wait was exceptionally long even considering it was the lunch rush.  Overall very good experiences.

PewKaoI-ubucd_Oz1XkYpA.text: Amazing food! Awesome salsa bar! I especially enjoyed the tiger shrimp tacos! Friendly staff, this place is a little bigger than the 16th street location.

DJZk8cXEDIlsjGEwlQHyaA.text: Love this spot, I drive from Chandler all the way to Glendale to enjoy this restaurant   Cochinita pibil tacos very flavorful  Tried the chicharron quesa was awesome  Definitely recommend this place  Small little restaurant with a whole lot of flavor The Horchata drink is delicious, my favorite by far, it's like no other!!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Horchata
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Horchata!! Amazing!!
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Chicharron quesa! Magnifico

_qJ_svRK9GUBStl_XHUxFg.text: This unique Taco Shop in Glendale offers a large menu with many vegetarian choices and specialty meats including fillet mingoin and mole! I love fish tacos and this beer battered shrimp taco hit the spot. The salsa bar has many choices the fresh varieties to go with any meal. I have to recommend the horchata it is a huge serving with nuts and fruit and it is worth stopping in just to order a fresh cold nutritious drink! It's easy to pass it by and parking is a little tight however the service is great and it has a full bar!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. The jicama salsa  on this fish taco was delicious but I highly recommend the horchata!!!

cuUehMCD2QDbU5gbXdAKgA.text: I had been wanting to come here for a long, long time! My friend Cynthia went here a few months ago, and told me it was legit! (I trust her opinion...she was born/raised in San Diego, and she knows what's up when it comes to Mexican food!)  We finally made it down here the other day for dinner.  We parked in the back lot, and walked inside.  We were greeted immediately and shown to a table.  We were served a basket of chips, browsed the menu for a bit and then placed our order.  I went with a plethora of tacos which included a fish taco, a mole taco, a cochinita pibil taco, an al pastor taco and a carne asada taco.  Here is how they were.............  Fish Taco-  They make these with dogfish.  It was a hefty sized taco and it was mighty delicious.  It had 2 pieces of perfectly fried fish inside.  I had never had dogfish until today.  It was a very meaty and chewy fish.  Most fish tacos are white fish that break apart easily.  This fish was almost like a steak!  I would definitely get this one again.  Mole Taco-  Shredded chicken with a rich mole sauce service on top of a double corn tortilla.  It was good, but not my favorite of my selections.  Not sure if I would get this one again.  A tad messy, too.  Cochinita Pibil Taco-  This was roasted pork shoulder topped with pickled red onions.  The pork was nice and moist, and the onions gave it a nice bite.  I would get it again.  Al Pastor Taco-  This taco came topped with a a decent amount of pork, some hot red sauce, some cool avocado sauce and also some pineapple.  It was definitely tasty.  Maybe not on par with my Tacos El Gordo in SD, but still a good al pastor taco.  I would get this one again.  Carne Asada Taco-  This was my favorite of the day!  This taco came prepared simple with just steak and some cabbage (It's an AZ thing..the cabbage).  This steak was so well marinated, and so tender, it was a pleasure to eat.  I wish I would have ordered maybe 3 or 4 of these things.  It was by far the best carne asada I have had in AZ, and could hold its own vs any asada back in SD.  It was incredibly legit!  I may come back and get this in a burrito from here.  Winner, winner, carne asada dinner!   Besides the great tacos, this place has a super awesome salsa bar!  They had at least 10 different, home made salsas on display.  I tried about 5 of them and each one was unique and tasty.  They have great chips, too!  Thin and crispy!  They went well with all the great salsas.  We got 2 baskets full.  Service was on point and all the young ladies working in the place were on top of everything!  I'm glad I went here and will definitely be coming back...soon!  Best Mexican food I have had in AZ so far!

RNB9BfyvoM-zDIMhrbc-8Q.text: Excellent service, servers were very kind. food was average. I will probably be back to try the lonches.

BngLTst_QV25hTmUV3EjNA.text: We went there on a Friday late evening around 8pm ish.  We were about 6 people in the group.  Got a seat right away.  There were about 3 or 4 tables occupied.  While we waited...and waited...and waited...after about 10 min, waitress came for our drink order.  Again waited and waited and waited....finally had to call the waitress and asked that people who came after us were offered table tortilla chips and salsa but no one asked anything at our table.  Then the waitress apologies and got us some chips and salsa.  Overall, the food was great, I would give five star ratings for the chef who made the food, taste and quality of food was good, but the service and wait staff needs to step up.  May not go there again since the service was very poor.

50JwwbIMKIJi9BYitHarCg.text: Visited La Santisima for the 2nd time today.. not impressed.. AT ALL! The place was full, which is fantastic for them, but they could not handle the amount of people in there. They had one waiter who was trying to take orders for all of the table. I won't speak on behalf of anyone else so our experience: it took our food 45 minutes to come out and when it did, my tacos were so dry I could barely swallow it. As the waiter set down our food she asked if everything was OK. After that, we didn't see her until I had to send my food back. My mom and I both had to send our plates back. In the 45 minutes we had to wait for our food, we asked for chip refills.. those took roughly 15 minutes each.. and they charge per basket. When our chips came out, we had little pieces of chips and our basket wasn't even full. The ONLY positive was the salsa bar.. when you had chips to eat it with.   Bottom line.. not a great experience.

rYms7qOd0QPG8i6WZMJ0TQ.text: Love the Salsa Bar. The Santisma Veggie Taco is Da Bomb. I did not care too much for the Cactus Veggie Taco but do not hold that against them. The street tacos and Mole are both wonderful too. Great food, divey interior. Great find says the gal who is not the biggest lover of Mexican food. I would go here again. Service was a bit slow though but nice ladies.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Tacos!

tK010yTOVT9qEDGhemmu5Q.text: I love this place. Been here quite a few times now.  I love this place because it stands out among the hordes of Mexican food places serving smothered in cheese and sauce Mexican food. That's not my Mexican food at all. La Santisima is.   The location is across 59th. Ave from Old Town Glendale so not exactly walkable from Old Town because who wants to cross Grand and risk death by car. There's a small parking lot in the back of the restaurant though.   It's never very busy when I've been for a weekend lunch or dinner. La Perla next door can be packed with patrons and 20 tables will be empty at La Santisima some weekends. That simply means less hassle to get some of the best food you can find in Glendale.  I would recommend trying anything with arrachera in the description and the al pastor tacos. Their seafood choices are bangin' too.   Their salsa bar will challenge your ideas of what a salsa can be made of.   If you want to go for lunch or dinner at La Santisima and you can't find a date, I'll go with you anytime.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Shark tacos AKA tiburon

HhRJGdmUTQLTHVdG9Pz0OA.text: Some of the best tacos we have ever had.  Had a great assortment of flavors, even vegetarian options.  Fast and friendly service. Loved all of the options to chose from.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Best tacos

npCpkI8OiQ6jEPNZ0PhOPA.text: Walked in tonite which restaurant was busy due to Glendale Glitters. Since I was by myself I sat at bar. After at least 10 minutes, I left due to no one greeting me or asking me if I wanted a drink despite multiple servers coming in & out my of bar area. Maybe no one is served at bar & only for show. Even as I walked out one server just looked at me & smiled which she saw me sitting at bar. I suggest your restaurant work on greeting people & making them feel welcome instead of ignoring them. You lost a customer tonite.

i72q85Ul6Ry4KVVrZjiDwg.text: Typically I am a person who only eats burritos with meat, pico, and some hot sauce.... Not anymore! Gaucho? Burrito is amazing! The combination of meat, cheese, vegetables and rice come together for an incredible symphony of flavors! Not to mention the tortilla had that perfect slight crisp but still chewiness. Don't pass this place up.

I wish they had better service they have a lot of staff but only one server for all tables

Slow service, messy salsa bar, small broken bits of tortilla chips in basket, weak margaritas and way smaller tacos than on our other visits. Hardly any fish on taco, beef taco was just that - beef on a small corn tortilla - nosauce, no garnish. New owners, perhaps? Will try other location and compare!

i7cGjhZg5bG-LeP3dEtk-Q.text: This place is located on the old strip drag of Glendale, AZ. The food is very good and uniquely paired together tacos! I had the Baja Sur Dogfish Shark Tacos Yum!! My daughter ordered Cabo Shrimp Tacos (We had to share!;)) loved them both! And I loved the the decor and I enjoyed the ambience. We have been a few times our dentist is located down the street, we went once with my fiance another wth my daughter and youngest son, and both times was fantastico! Keep up the great food! Happy eating! I gave four because it took our server a longer than normal wait to come take our drink order and food order.

odVmLtJw8mKvnGmLbvCbdg.text: I used to love this place. My husband, daughter and I used to come here once a week. Then they added the extra vegetarian options. Yay! Because I'm a vegetarian.  Definetly TRY this place at least once. It is good. And if you are vegetarian or vegan you will loooooove it. I promise. It just isnt one of those "eat once a week" kind of restaurants anymore.  I'm not going to give it 5 stars now, even though 6 months to a year ago I would've given it 5 stars (is 10 possible?) For some reason the prices went up and the quality of the food feels like it has been steadily declining. Everytime we go its just not what it used to be. Maybe there's new management? A new cook? I'm not sure. But if you had asked me 6 months ago about the place I would not have hesitated to recommend it.   Its definetly authentic though I'll give them that. I love this restaurant and really hope that the quality starts going back up because I miss eating there. It was the only restaurant my family and I would go to. And with the new vegetarian options. My goodness, I would eat here every day!

CbWSfK6VpyhaTsbHPpMlEA.text: We went here to give it a try as I love Mexican food. I am all for the whole-in-the wall Mexican food it's the best you can get. I will have to say this place left much to be desired. I'm always reluctant to give negative reviews but I have to be honest so that we spent our money in the right places. I liked in on a positive note so I will  start with what went wrong. As soon as we entered we were confused as to whether to wait by the door or see ourselves. Turns out we were able to see ourselves but upon sitting I noticed a lot of the chairs were stained so I felt a little uncomfortable. I managed to find a somewhat decent chair and my husband and I ordered tacos which is normally our first go to at a place where unfamiliar with. I like that they had so many different sauce the choices that was really great. We ordered cups of water with lemon which came in cheap throwaway plastic cups. When the tacos came our plates looked cracked like they were ready to be retired. I had three tacos And out the 3 I ordered I only liked one...same for my husband. We were pretty much done at that point. I thought it would be hard to mess up street tacos but apparently not. On a good note the salsa and chips were good and the waitress was kind.

hAI7zjm1sSEqTahwU-47xg.text: In Phoenix for 2 days so wanted some good Mexican food..this place is the best. Wanted to come again the next day but I would've missed my flight..get anything on the menu and it's good. Very clean, friendly waiters, a hole in the wall restaurant but definitely not bad..might need a bigger parking lot though as it's very cramped

RUZdI2Sa3uWy0dYGVWPGtw.text: I go hear frequently and have known that the waitresses and service is not very good but still went because the food was great. Tonight I went and the burritos were smaller and was missing ingredients, didn't taste as good. They normally put a small salad with cranberries, avacados, tomatoes, and lettuce, this time it was just tomatoes and lettuce. My boyfriend order a large salad(mind you, the last time we ordered this salad we shared it with three other people) when they brought it out it looked like a side salad! I couldn't believe it. The waitress said that they changed the sizes and that she would bring us more because we weren't told this. We waited and she never did. I finally had to ask her if she was still bringing it before she brought it. If the food and service continues to be this way I will not be dining here anymore

mBv5fxSMgeD4PlyuiDHTow.text: Not impressed. We went in around 4pm and there was only one table in there. Exterior was really original and set a good vibe, then we stepped inside and I felt like I was in a tattoo artists bedrooom.   Took about 5-10 minutes for someone to come out of the kitchen to greet us and seat us which was not a good first impression. The salsa bar had good variety but was set up very poorly. The "togo" salsa containers you use to grab you salsas were so small you couldnt even fit a tortilla chip into it, We had to get a plastic spoon to get our salsa onto our chip because there was no metal utensils on the table. They didnt provide us little plates either so our table was a mess before we even started ordering.  As our tacos hit the table the first thing we noticed where that both mine and my husbands plates had big cracks on them. Flea market much?I got the smoked marlin taco which had the texture of canned tuna fish with a minestrone like vegetable concoction on top and the shrimp tacos, pretty decent. The corn tortillas were pretty flimsy though and resembled the storebought el paso brand.  Service was not the best either, our questions about the tacos were answered with finger pointing at the menu and blank looks like...uhh you dunno what achiote rojo is?   All in all, the fact that we said we should have gone to chipotle instead says everything.

O20ZJN0Qr7WyWIvIPD-6PQ.text: The beans were watery and too salty for my taste.The rice is plain white rice just as you see in the picture with corn no flavor to me, both rice and beans were warm not cold.The salsa bar is decent. Not a fan of the cilanto cream salsa or guacomole sour cream salsa. I love simple good cooked foods. They do have vegetarian foods.

fQOYMRDJDscD_IJMAL-Ijg.text: DELICIOUS tacos and a wide variety of salsa to choose from.  I LOVE the strawberry salsa. Restaurant is very clean. Staff is very friendly . Music is good. I would bring my family and friends  here. Definitely deserves five stars.

5u_O6-ufnRHW2gkixWooJw.text: We had a party of 13 on a quiet Saturday noon. Sure they have the Salsa Bar but the food doesn't measure up to what I have been reading. We had everything from Burro's to Street Taco's to SPECIAL Taco's.  The overall opinion was just OK. Let me speak on my 3 Carne Asada street Taco's with beans and rice. Taco's were not even close to being hot. Not even warm. Meat quality and tenderness was poor. Beans were GREAT. What the hell is white rice doing in a Mexican restaurant? Had better at the same price. Had to ask for chips and more water. Poor teenage waitress was worked. I realize they add 18% automatically but then don't ask for another tip on the check. Service and food was not worth 18%. Would we go back NO. Too many Mexican restaurants in the valley to have poor food. Oh well you go you might enjoy it. It's your money .

vkzu-LYNeXfVc_JXKC_DwQ.text: Great food awful service.  Looked like only one waitress and one helper. So I felt sorry for her but I was completely forgotten after being there for over 30 minutes had to go ask for her to come out and take my order. The only reason I waited is because I was starving and when I got there I did order a beer from The Host and that did come right away. No one ever checked to see how my food was and when I was finished I waited another 15 minutes and no one came so I went inside and got my check.

a-gafbGlJCFtSPBzWDOO2w.text: There are several reviews here that state that the service is poor - I humbly disagree. While it may take a few minutes to get your order, the atmosphere and the servers are awesome. Our waitress was fantastic from the get-go. To top it off, the food is unbelievable. Highly recommend.

UWBsvhO-B4Gvk1D-G6ksrQ.text: Incredible tacos and quesadillas and salsa bar like the original, plus the space is large and beautiful! Service is a little slower, though.

mcamoSAK_wCv9JsHST5nNg.text: The asada meat smelled bad and tasted worse when we informed about it, not even an apology and they still charged us for the street taco. I won't be coming back.

2mUy-GG5Mw8YHSk8Q1oHsQ.text: Posted Sunday, December 15, 2013, but was deleted....  Rice and beans, just like Nana's house. Over 15+ tacos you can choose from. Each has its own flavor and distinction. Atmosphere is basic and modern. Paintings hang on walls. The simplicity of the restaurant is only supported by the flavorful tacos. This is a must to go spot in downtown Glendale.

hEAqAIx2hd22jFEdFDgDGQ.text: Great service--Nick is stellar! Margaritas were great, food was delicious, salsa bar is fun, and all very inexpensive.

UFvcsB-vU2ULGlLiHL9t_A.text: This is soooo much closer to where I live than the original location. Awesome :) I'll be back. The only kink is service and signage. The people are new and are being trained so that should improve. I swear one of the servers also works/worked at the original. This location is just as hard to spot though. Small building, but plenty of parking in back.  I'm a huge fan of the original. Been there multiple times. I was much more impressed by the mole being served here, but not so much the dogfish. It was still good, but seemed to be more batter this time around. Cabo shrimp and marlin are good at both locals. Two taco plates with rice and beans and two horchatas = $25-30  I finally have enough experience with these restaurants to complain just a little bit. 1. Go back to putting the rice and beans in cups or bowls please. I am begging you! I'm so tired of my tacos getting soggy from my beans spreading across my entire plate. Get plates with ridges and sections or something. Something! Anything! 2. The music IS REALLY LOUD at both locations. I'd like to not have to yell at my dining partners. 3. No pecans in the horchata anymore? Did I miss this menu change or was it just a hiccup at the newbie?

snXKwlorpx-WQhgwTEzMwA.text: FINALLY!!!!  Bomb street tacos!  YES!!!  Their salsa bar is awesome sauce (pun intended)!  House margaritas also fabulous!  An all around great find, I WILL be back!!!

kLn5fC2ftcBTYuipBAEWZQ.text: Had the Mole and it was great!!!!!  I had the horchata it had great flavor but I wasn't a fan of the extra noise on top of it, next time I will hold on the extras and just ask for the drink. My wife had the fish tacos and LOVED them.

Hdt0YObGaQe1S5a7N2L-Sw.text: La Santisima is not authentic Mexican food at all. Only the plate names but that's it. I liked the chips, salsa bar (because of the variety but I only tried the Mexican salsa and guacamole salsa), avocado salad side and decoration portraits but the tacos, burrito and horchata were not good. The tacos were plain, the chicken in the burrito didn't have flavor and it was served on a broken plate and the horchata didn't taste like actual horchata. Also, there was only one another party so I don't understand why the service was so slow. I definitely would not go back!

M10rSoBbKsYYIjhswvno6g.text: This place is awesome!! So many salsas to choose from!! If you want a taste of authentic Mexican food... Come here!!!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. Shrimp Taco was dee-lish!!
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Glendale, AZ, United States. My favorite!! Cochinita Pibil Taco!

StT464hJqNG-lvY5J5QVxQ.text: I really enjoyed the salsa bar from the Mexicana to the 7 chile's one.  I had the 3 street  taco meal with rice and beans.  Meats I chose were carne  asada, mayan pibil and the Aztec  tingi. The carne asada was dry and not flavorful and i didn't enjoy the taste of the tingi taco.  the last taco made it all worth it the Mayan pibil was delicious and I can't wait to have this again. They marinate the red onions in lemon, this simple touch makes the tacos so much better.  Javier had the red beef burrito this was very spicy but he enjoyed it.  We also had the house Margarita. They put lemons and orange slices in the drink.  This was an excellent margarita and for 8.00, I think this was a great deal. Our total bill for 2 meals, 2 beers and a Margarita was 37.00. The only down side to this place was the old plates. They were not the glossy ones and had chips and paint missing. I know it goes with the decor but i think this could be worked on.  We will be returning to try more food from this taco shop.

bMInqBekkXySeHxKztKixQ.text: We live in  Glendale and was excited to go here. Akward small salsa bar. No one greeted us as we came in. Self seating I assume. Who works here? No uniforms.  Nasty standing water by salsa bar. This food better be good! Weird way to get to the salsa bar where you have to twist and turn. No utensils or napkins on tables. You have to ask and wait.    Positive.  Music and atmosphere is good. The outside patio looks nice. The prices are decent and they look to have a good vision. They have really nice art work but walls need painting.  Seating is good and looks nice wooden tops and cast iron details.  A bit more attention to details and some training will have this a destination for Glendale folks who want authenticity yet do not want to go near the hustle and bustle of Westgate.

1KjGZ0RT1ajSgi9dhfvUuA.text: I visit my family here in Phoenix at least twice a year for the past 12 years.  All the food here in the Phoenix area so far has been mediocre to say the least.  Till I ate here, the carne asada is on point and the alpastor is very good.   I also tried the veggie quesadilla which was out of this world.  The salsa selection is so good that I would have gave it more than 5 stars just because of the great assortments of salsas they have.

DW_YLxNJ1RGUXfKax9SeNw.text: This place was featured on Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives .... What a great  Taco and the spin on the Orchata with pecan nuts and cinnamon. .. great flavor!

28ZrPpr5sG26maQqHeoGZA.text: Oh my gosh. What a totally different experience from my last visit.  I will come back during the week to eat, but the staff on the weekend was horrible.  I sent my food back twice and it still came back to me wrong.  The waitress didn't speak a word of English and could not understand at all what I wanted. I ordered the exact same entree I had the last time I was here but it was a totally different meal that was delivered to me. I even showed them the picture I posted in Yelp as to what my food should look like. They tried to match the picture, but they had no clue. So disappointed! I could go on and on, but I won't. Again I don't recommend going on the weekend.  The thing that shocked me the most was even after the horrible experience with the food being sent back, I had to pay the full check. If a customer sends something back twice and it still comes back wrong, they should not be charged.  The food should be the same no matter when it is ordered.

paP9hJpCnSsYeLP8206znQ.text: Al pastor burrito for the win!!! love the pecan salsa!

qIrCLJgQJ6NNXd7TYX-OFA.text: Stumbled upon this place and I'm so glad I did... This is the best Mexican food hands down in all of AZ! From the family recipe for horchata to all the different types of tacos you can see that they pride themselves with only using quality products! Cant wait to go again.

RmHZUpGeBjFXX1bOcLaMpw.text: We LOVE this place. All of the ingredients are really fresh and delicious. The unique salsa bar is a nice touch as well.

pdw1bEwEZgb7F8MfkD661Q.text: I had a groupon to this lovely place and since then I've visited this place TWICE! I absolutely love the horchata and have definitely not tasted anything better.

AvgNnRUzaggtry73_zxWaQ.text: Went here on a whim after passing by. Super happy we did. My husband had Carne Asada tacos , I had the Pastor they were amazing! My husband is supppppper picky about Mole. I make him try it everywhere we go for the past 14 years . Never found a good one till now! Amazing!!! But the most incredible thing for me was the Horchata holy good lord I loved it. I will be stopping by just to get that on my way home from work on many occasions. The waiters were a bit shy but very attentive without being annoying. I will defiantly be bringing everyone I know here!

R1Fb-1unwpOJhRccZQgy2A.text: First time visit, late Saturday night. Food was good, though presentation wasn't too pretty. Ordered a burrito and when served, that's all that was on my plate. A little sauce and maybe a sprinkle of cheese with some garnish would have painted a prettier picture, but it nevertheless tasted very good. We shall return.

uG3vOuMw1oRSD_nOmXYa1Q.text: I've been to this restaurant before and was told previously to sit where ever I wanted. So I did the same thing tonight when I arrived. The restaurant is very small to begin with. Maybe 5min after I arrived, a pregnant girl walked by and held up a finger in my direction as if to say "I'll be with you in just a minute". After about 15 min, I was finally acknowledged by someone and given some chips. At least 30min after I arrived, I still hadn't been greeted or spoken to by an employee. I counted at least 4 other tables of people who had arrived after me and already had drinks on their tables. One of them even had their food already. Still, no one came by to take my order. I felt like I was on a hidden camera tv show at this point. There appeared to be maybe 3 servers, and the restaurant has maybe 10 tables inside, with a handful outside. It was busy, I understand that, but this experience was ridiculous. I finally gave up and left. It's hard to imagine a business that operates this way being able to survive.

nWFdTTAdEqSJ8JoRmN3cTQ.text: Yes. Yes. Yes.  Anybody who does not give this restaurant a 5 is a food critic who's just trying to take down one of the best taco shops in America!  We were so excited when this place moved over to the west side closer to our house.  Try to quesadillas and the horchata.

rwwne4RqVU9YJimL1zpCJA.text: Luchadores, sugar skulls, and amazingly flavorful spicy cuisine of Mexico. What more can you ask for. Be fore warned however, the salsa bar is full of spices salsas. This is not for the weak of heart!

zZuqDbh82yVShYxenYwDZw.text: Great food! Great salsa! Did not realize it was featured on Diners Drive in and Dives! Good margaritas too!

QYOlPYiJuzcNefC7IECrdg.text: Love this place.  The carne asada tacos are our favorite.  The salsa bar is the best I have ever had.  Wonderful flavors to add to the tacos, so that we never get tired of the the same flavor.  The home made flan is to die for (different flavors) and so is the chocolate cake when they run out of flan.

Gr4qY0wai2UOVIYg60uVtA.text: My husband and I had dinner here this past weekend for the first time. We had been wanting to try it, but hadn't gotten around to it. We are glad we finally took the time to have dinner here. It was really good.  The tacos were fabulous, the margaritas were good and the choices of salsa were great. The service is a little slow, so if you're in a hurry pick another time to visit this wonderful establishment. I definitely will be returning and bringing friends and family!

e2Oenxi3J1R5bbtCVU9rYw.text: Salsa bar great food.  Everyone in the group was making plans what they would order  when they come back

5sAHe31_lPTiS18ZYXAtig.text: We dined here last night and I can't say enough good things.  The menu was full of delicious options, with a flexible ordering scheme.  Ala carte tacos are large and come with two tortillas, so they are easy to share.  Plates come with two of the large tacos with wonderful refried beans and tender rice.  We had the Gaucho, which is an Argentine marinated steak taco with fresh avocado, and the Oaxacan chicken mole taco- unbelievable!  The best part is the salsa bar- amazing flavors and textures.  Light and tasty tortilla chips are complimentary.  The decor is quirky and fun, with really nice furniture. The service was friendly and attentive, and the price was very reasonable- lots of food, one drink each for 5 people for $60.

qQ8VDCAuU4rgEyqBzrxxRw.text: We LOVE this place and couldn't be happier to have them on the west side!  Fresh, unique, incredibly delicious food in a comfortable atmosphere and contrary to other reviews, our service has always been exemplary!  Not at all the typical swimming-in-grease-and-cheese Mexican food but fresh and interesting and an extensive menu!  We are regulars and have hardly made a dent at trying everything they offer!  The salsa bar is like no other and stands on its own in making this a must-go destination!  Give this great restaurant a try....you won't be disappointed.  Then, tell all your friends and family so one of Glendale's best restaurants stays here!

aDIhQb-Avi-cd1YlutPxAw.text: It was a little hard to find and went past twice!  However, although small, it had nice and a very interesting decor (loved the padded chairs).  The menu was large with very different types of tacos and burros you don't often see.  As mentioned by others,  the salsa bar was excellent with lots of choices with a surprising (and tasty) fruit salsa!  I was slightly put off as we ordered our iced teas at lunch and they were delivered in wax paper cups which was not what you would expect in a sit down restaurant. Then the meal came in baskets like you might get at a Sonic drive-in which was also a little disconcerting.  However, the meal certainly made up for these drawbacks (which in the end is the most important quality!).  We had the lunch plate with a small paper cup of beans and another with rice but believe it or not, I was very full at the conclusion of the meal and even took one of the corn tortilla off one of the tacos as I was 'stuffed'. Overall, I wish they had served on regular plates and regular glasses but the food was excellent. The service was also attentive but not intrusive. Will definitely return!

SKPlGXk92ims9sK_ztsMEQ.text: this was our second time going to the restaurant food is great but the service is so bad we will not be returning again the first time we just thought had a bad server so we returned a second time and found out its always like this service is horrible will not recommend it to anyone because of the service and my 4 year old daughter was served her tacos on a broken plate
